He has his own garage at his uncles' house where he has lived since he was a child. He also sells spare parts, and he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles, He wants to increase his sales and create more income to cover his expenses and help his uncles out with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Jageswari Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group's loan will go to Suchitra, a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a small village in the state of Odisha, on the eastern coast of India.

Suchitra is pictured on the extreme right in the image above. She owns a stationary shop in the village and would like to expand her shop by buying more items such as paper, envelopes, pens, and pencils. With her portion of her group's 135,000 Rupee loan, she can buy these items in bulk at a cheaper price and earn a higher profit. Her husband works alongside her and all of their family income is dependent on the shop. 

This is Suchitra's first loan, so she is excited and hopes that with the increased stock, they will be able to save more money. Most importantly, she wants to be able to support her children's education as they grow. As a child, she was only able to study until the second standard, but now she is working hard to send her children to a good school and hopes they will become engineers.
  
The other women in Jagaswari SHG are planning to use their loans for their own small shops or agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to purchase paper, envelopes, pens and pencils for her stationary shop

loans.name: Honorio Wilder

texts.es:
Honorio es un hombre muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado iniciar su negocio de mecánica, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Honorio esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar una maquila desenllantadora, con lo cual podrá realizar mejor su trabajo y poder atender a sus clientes de mejor manera, así podrá seguir esforzándose en su negocio y cumplir su sueño:” Tener una gran taller mecánico”.
texts.en:
Honorio is a very hard-working man. With a lot of effort, he was able to start his own mechanic business, with which he is able to earn money to get ahead.

Honorio is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their support he will be able to buy a tire removal machine. With this, he will be able to do his work better and will be able to attend to his customers in the best possible manner. He will thus be able to keep striving in his business and to fulfill his dream: "To have a great mechanic shop."

loans.use: to buy a tire removal machine

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: El señora Dionicia vive en la provincia de Tiraque en casa de sus padres, es madre soltera tiene un hijo que depende de ella, pero no tiene muchos recursos económicos, para trabajar tiene que contratar personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos y después ir a vender en la feria local, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado y semilla, de esta forma podrá seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionicia lives at her parents' house in Tiraque Province. She is a single mother with a child who is dependent on her.

Even though she does not have a great deal of financial resources, Dionicia must hire seasonal laborers to help her with planting and harvesting her products. Afterwards, she sells her crops at the local fair. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy livestock and seeds. This will enable her to continue working so that she can sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and seeds.

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es: Diana, a sus 35 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 11 y 3 años, a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola y por los que lucha incasablemente para darles el sustento diario. Desde hace 3 años inició su propio negocio como alternativa para generar los recursos económicos suficientes para solventar las necesidades del hogar, ya que se encontraba desempleada y le era difícil conseguir oportunidades laborales; por ello montó una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, allí ofrece algunos productos de la canasta familiar, mecato, gaseosas, licor y los fines de semana vende productos fritos como empanadas, chorizos, tamales, pasteles de pollo, entre otros; de esta forma ha logrado salir adelante en compañía de sus pequeños hijos. Su tenacidad, fortaleza y perseverancia, la han llevado a lograr los objetivos que se propone y la motivan para solicitar el segundo ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, cerveza, gaseosas, licor y productos de la canasta familiar), así tendrá disponibilidad suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la llegada de la temporada navideña, en la que aumentan las ventas y los ingresos que percibe por su labor. Esto le da la posibilidad de seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mayor número de artículos, logrando estabilizar la economía familiar para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
35-year-old Diana is a single mother of two children ages 11 and 3, whom she has gotten ahead on her own and for whom she strives tirelessly, in order to give them daily sustenance. Three years ago she started her own business as an alternative for generating enough financial resources to cover the needs of her household, as she was unemployed and it was difficult for her to find opportunities for work. For this reason she opened a small store located in her home, where she offers a number of grocery products, pastries, soft drinks and liquor. And on the weekends she sells fried products like empanadas, sausages, tamales and chicken pastries, among other items. In this way she has been able to get ahead in company with her small children. 

Her tenacity, strength and perseverance have allowed her to reach the objectives she has proposed, and have motivated her to request her second cycle of loan for assorted items she wants to buy wholesale (pastries, beer, soft drinks, liquor and grocery products). In this way she will have enough stock to satisfy the demand that is increasing with the arrival of the Christmas season, in which sales increase along with the earnings she receives for her work. This gives her the potential to keep advancing in order to fulfill the dream of expanding her business and offering a greater number of items, allowing her to stabilize the family budget to give her children a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy assorted items wholesale (pastries, beer, soft drinks, liquor and grocery products)

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Don José tiene 38 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos. Es originario de la ciudad de Granada. De oficio comerciante y contador, se dedica al negocio de cafetín. Inicio este negocio hace dos años. Trabajaba como contador y oficial de crédito en un micro financiera. Después obtuvo un negocio en uno de los mercados de la ciudad pero lo vendió porque no le generaba muchas ganancias, y con el dinero  obtenido de esa venta construyo su vivienda y parte de su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con el negocio de cafetín ubicado en unos de los colegios de la ciudad. Su meta es que crezca su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: golosinas, gaseosa, útiles escolares, entre otros, con el fin de suplir con la demanda de los estudiantes. Estima que este crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias para remodelar su negocio. Su plan futuro es mantener la variedad de productos y así crecer más su cafetín.
texts.en: José is 38 years old. He is single and doesn’t have children. He is from the city of Granada. His occupation is in commerce and as an accountant. His business is a small cafe. He began the business two years ago. He used to work as as an accountant and a loan officer at a micro finance organization. After that he obtained a business at one of the markets in the city, but he sold it because it didn’t generate much income. With the money he earned from that, he built his house and part of his business. He now has his small cafe business located in one of the city’s high schools. His goal is to grow his business. He is requesting the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, school supplies, and other things, with the goal of fulfilling the demand from the students. He believes the loan will be beneficial because he will be able to improve his income and remodel his business. His plan for the future is to maintain the variety of products and grow his small cafe.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, and school supplies, among other items.

loans.name: Arabinda Shg Group

texts.en:
Kamala is pictured above in the green sari, second from the left in the front row. She has united the women in her village to form Arabinda SHG so they can work alongside each other to grow their businesses and contribute to the welfare of their family and their village. 

For work, she owns a tent house, a staple shop in her community that provides colorful coverings for weddings, engagements, and other festivities. A talented seamstress, Kamala makes and mends all of the tents herself from cloth. With her portion of the group loan, she will buy some new colors and replace some of her cloths that have worn out. In addition, she also likes to rent out other necessities for festivals and would like to use her loan to buy an updated sound system for her customers so that she can rent it out at a higher price.

She hopes to use the earnings from her tent house to continue to send her children to good schools, which get more expensive as they grow older. The other women in her group are mostly in dairy farming and own other small shops in the village.

loans.use: to buy an updated sound system to rent and more cloths to make tents to rent

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es: Ana Virginia, tiene 31 años de edad, es Lic. en derecho y ejerce su profesión por cuenta propia, alquila un local y ha puesto un foto estudio en donde toma fotos, hace legalizaciones de documentos, levantado de texto, encolochado, con el apoyo de su madre. Ana es soltera y no tiene hijos aun, busca la manera de mejorar su vivienda, solicita este crédito para poder comprar los materiales para construir un anexo que hará en dos etapas, siendo esta la primera,  para dicho objetivo necesita comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro y pagar la mano de obra, esta mejora le permitirá mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Virginia, 31, has a law degree and practices her profession independently.  She rents a space and has set up a photo studio where she takes photographs, legalizes documents, scans texts, and binds books with her mother's help.

Ana's single and has no children yet.  She's trying to find ways to improve her home.  She's requesting this loan to buy the supplies to build an addition that she'll do in two stages.

This is the first stage, for which Ana needs to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, and rebar, and pay for labor.  This improvement will make her home more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Con el propósito de ayudar a su familia ha decidido tener su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos como lociones, cremas, maquillajes etc. y ropa nueva como blusas, pantalones, ropa interior por encargos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de cosméticos como lociones, cremas y ropa como jeans, blusas y ropa interior, para tener mayor inventario y aumentar las ventas. su meta es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Esmeralda is 33 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has two children. She lives in the municipality of Masica, Atlántida. With the goal of helping her family, she has decided to have her own business selling cosmetics such as perfumes, lotions, make up, etc. and new clothing, such as blouses, pants, and underwear by special order. She makes her sales by working as a street seller and in her house. The loan she requests is for HNL 8,000.00 (Honduras Lempiras) and she will invest it in buying cosmetics such as perfumes and lotions and clothing such as jeans, blouses, and underwear so she can have a larger inventory and increase her sales. Her goal is to continue working in order to help her children with their studies and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes and lotions and clothing such as jeans, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Doña Marta, tiene 74 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 6 años que Doña Marta tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, ella comenzó vendiendo solo refrescos y ahora vende azúcar, arroz, manteca, productos de aseo, pan, verduras, churros, y otros abarrotes. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo siendo el noveno ciclo y es por 8,000 Lempiras, con el cual va seguir surtiendo la pulpería con productos básicos como pan, refrescos, churros, jabón, manteca, azúcar, arroz, café, condimentos etc. Su propósito es seguir trabajando para ayudar en lo que pueda a su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 74 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Marta has had her business selling food products for the past 6 years. She began by selling just soft drinks, and now she sells sugar, rice, shortening, cleaning products, bread, chips, and other grocery items. She is currently requesting another loan, since this is the ninth loan cycle, for HNL 8,000.00 (Honduras Lempiras). She will use it to continue stocking her small grocery store with basic products such as bread, soft drinks, chips, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, condiments, etc. Her goal is to continue working so she can help her family as much as she can.

loans.use: bread, soft drinks, chips, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Sundos

texts.en: Sundos is 18 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her three siblings and her parents. Her father is retired from the military. Sundos is studying in her first year for a Bachelor of History degree. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially. Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis, which prevents them from paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca es una señora de 49 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora, ama de casa y agricultora, con muchos ánimos y deseos de salir adelante junto a su esposo y sus hijos 4 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella y la mayor está casada y en hogar a parte. De los hijos que dependen de ella al mayor tiene una edad 15 años y el próximo año va a segundo de carrera, la segunda tiene 11 años y acaba de terminar el sexto grado y el menor de 8 años que ya el próximo año va a 4 grado. Doña Blanca tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completa gracias al apoyo moral y financiero de sus padres y una gran experiencia en el cultivo de café ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a temprana edad las diferentes técnicas cultivar café. Desde hace 15 años se dedica en compañía de su esposo al cultivo de café ya que en su familia esta actividad ha sido factor importante para el ingreso de su economía. El terreno que juntos en familia trabajan es propio es heredado por sus padres el cual está ubicado a 40 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando o en vestía. 
Sus metas y esperanzas para con su negocio es poder ampliarlo, generar mayores ganancias y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Como madre para sus hijos apoyarlos en sus estudios, darles la oportunidad de poder prepararse académicamente y que ellos no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud por la falta de apoyo económico.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y poder asistir sus cultivos de café previniendo el deterioro por los cambios climáticos, enfermedades como la roya y bichos como la broca.
texts.en:
Blanca is 49 years old. She is hardworking, enterprising, a home maker, and a farmer. She has a great desire to get ahead in life with her husband and 4 children, of whom 3 are economically dependent on her. The oldest is married and lives apart from the family. Of the children who still depend on her, the oldest is 15 years old and next year he will go to high school. The second is 11 years old and just finished the sixth grade. The youngest one, who is 8 years old, will go to 4th grade next year. Blanca completed primary school, thanks to the moral and economic support of her parents and her experience in coffee cultivation. It was her parents who taught her from an early age about the different techniques for cultivating coffee. 

For the past 15 years, she has worked along with her husband to grow coffee since in her family this business has been an important factor for earning income. The land that the two of them work is her own, which she inherited from her parents. It is located 40 minutes away from her house. She gets there by walking or on a mule. 

Her goals and hopes for her business are to be able to expand it, earn more income, and strengthen the business for her children. As a mother, she supports her children in their studies and provides them the opportunity to prepare themselves academically so that they won’t go through the same situation she did in her youth due to a lack of economic support.

She has now requested a loan for buying agricultural inputs so that she can tend to her coffee plants and prevent deterioration from climate changes and plant illnesses such as the “la roya” [a fungal disease that attacks the plant leaves] and insect pests such as the coffee berry borer.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs in order to tend to her coffee plants.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his four older brothers, younger sister, and his parents. Two of his brothers are police officers. Yazan is studying for his Masters’ degree majoring in Accounting. He is in his first year. He is planning to continue his study to find a job in his study field after graduation, in order to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sufyan

texts.en: Sufyan lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with his two siblings and his mother. His father is deceased. Sufyan is studying for his Bachelor’s Degree, majoring in Nursing. He is in his second year. He is planning to continue his study to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to provide good support for his family after his fathers’ death. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is 22 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his three siblings and his parents. Odai is studying for his Bachelor’s in Business Administration. He is in his 4th year. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his field after graduation to start earning a better income to be a good support for his family. He does not currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Because Malak is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Malak was born in 1990. She is married and lives at a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband has been running his mini market for one year. He started his project with a small amount of money and he is now trying to expand his project by buying a larger amount of food products to earn better income and improve their living conditions. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Malak decided to help him by applying for this youth loan.

loans.use: to help her husband stock his mini market.

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario

texts.es: Ivania del Rosario 36 años de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad originaria del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, turismo, las playas, es una microempresaria que brinda el servicio juegos de nintendos y vídeos en su casa de habitación, al igual que también se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos, chinerias, entre otros, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos todos unos profesionales y realizarle unas mejoras a su casa de habitación. el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de un activo fijo que es cambiar un televisor que se la ha dañado y darles mantenimientos a los otros para así brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes mas en estas fechas que su demanda crece mayormente, también para invertir en la compra de mercadería en general como: zapatos, perfumes, cremas, ropa, entre otros. Ivania agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Ivania del Rosario is 36 years old. She is married and has two children. She is from the municipality of the Chinangeda, which is located in the western part of the country, where commerce, tourism, and beaches. She is a small business owner who provides Nintendo game and video game services in her home. She also sells general merchandise, such as: various styles of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes, among other items. One of her dreams is to be able to see her children all become professionals and also to make some improvements to her house. The purpose of this loan is to buy a fixed asset- a television to replace one that has been damaged, and to perform maintenance on the others so she can provide better service to her customers, especially during this time of year when demand increases a lot. She will also invest in the purchase of general merchandise, such as: shoes, perfumes, lotions, and clothing, among other things. Ivania appreciates very much the support that Kiva lenders offer to people of few economic resources.

loans.use: to buy a piece of furniture, which is a television that has been damaged, to perform maintenance on the others, and to invest in general merchandise.

loans.name: Wilder Edilson

texts.es: Wilder, a sus 26 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una legumbrería que inició hace varios meses como alternativa para obtener recursos por cuenta propia. La idea surgió luego de ser despedido de un supermercado en el  que trabajó por varios años, desempeñando diversas labores y entre ellas, la atención en el área de frutas y verduras, de allí obtuvo la experiencia y fue un motivo más para iniciar con su proyecto. El negocio se encuentra ubicado al lado del supermercado en el que trabajaba anteriormente y, gracias a ello cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocido en el sector, pues la zona es muy transitada; allí trabaja solo todos los días y de esta manera genera los recursos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una estantería, un refrigerador y realizar adecuaciones locativas (pintar el negocio), con esto podrá dar una mejor imagen al establecimiento, logrando atraer nuevos clientes para aumentar su nivel de ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. De esta forma, Wilder desea continuar con su labor y fortalecer cada día más su negocio, pues se ha convertido en la principal fuente de ingresos con los que puede brindar un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida a las personas que ama.
texts.en: Wilder is 26 years old. He works in his own business, a vegetable store that he started several months ago as an alternative to earn his own income. The idea came to him when he was let go from a supermarket where he had worked for several years. He had various duties there, and among them was tending to the area of fruits and vegetables. That was where he got experience and it was one more motivation to start his own business. The business is located next to the supermarket where he used to work, and because of this he has the advantage of being recognized in the neighborhood, which gets a lot of traffic. He works there on his own every day and in this way he earns the income to provide the basic necessities for his family. He is currently requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of shelves, a refrigerator, and to make some improvements to the store (paint it). This way he will give the business a better image and attract new customers so that he can increase his sales and the income he receives. Wilder wants to continue with his work and strengthen his business every day because it has become his principal source of income, which he can use to provide for better well being and living conditions for the people he loves.

loans.use: to buy shelves, a refrigerator, and to make some improvements to the store (paint it).

loans.name: Joma'a

texts.en:
Joma’a is 21 years old and lives with his family in Ramallah. Four months ago he started his own Internet coffee shop business for games and internet usage in his town. It was an impressive step forward, and that's why he is working hard to improve it.

In order to increase his business capital, Joma’a asked Ryada for this youth loan .He plans to buy screens and to better decorate his shop.

Joma’a hopes that this loan will lead to supporting the needs of his family and reinvesting in his business.

loans.use: to buy screens and to better decorate his shop

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
O senhor Augusto, tem 37 anos de idade,  vive maritalmente e tem três filhos dos quais um frequenta o nίvel primário e os dois não têm idade escolar e trabalha como  balconista num estabelecimento hoteleiro.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar cimento, pedra, areia aros  para melhorar a sua casa.
O seu sonho é crescer profissionalmente através do empenho e desempenho no local de trabalho, adiquirir uma viatura para facilitar o seu deslocamento e casar oficialmente.
texts.en:
Mr. Augusto is 37 years old, lives with his partner and has 3 children of whom 1 goes to primary school; the other 2 are not of school-going age yet. He works as a shop assistant in a hotel.

With this loan he will buy cement, stone, sand and rings to improve his home.

His dreams are to grow professionally through hard work and excellent performance in his job, acquire a vehicle to facilitate his commute and get married officially.

loans.use: cement, stone, sand and rings to improve his home.

loans.name: Admira

texts.pt:
Admira, casada, mãe de 3 filhos, somente 2 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também 3 enteados que vivem com ela. 
É Agente de Rega na Açucareira de Xinavane por período indeterminado.
 Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais material de construção (Janelas, portas, sacos de cimento e vidros) para dar continuidade com obras da sua moradia a fim de melhorar as condições de habitação.
Tem como sonhos finalizar com obras, mobiliar a sua moradia e ver seus filhos formados. Tem como principais desafios a falta de fundos para realizar seus sonhos e a falta de apoio moral no envolvimento desses filhos em campanhas educacionais.
texts.en:
Admira is married and has three children, only two of whom attend different levels of school. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports three stepchildren who live with her.
She has been an irrigation worker for the Xinavane sugar company for an indefinite period of time.
With the current loan for 20,000mt she intends to purchase more construction supplies (windows, doors, bags of cement and glass). That way she'll continue building her house in order to improve her living conditions.
Her dreams are to finish the construction work, furnish her home and see her children graduate. Her main challenges are the lack of funds for accomplishing her dreams and the lack of moral support in regards to her children's involvement in educational campaigns.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies (windows, doors, bags of cement and glass).

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
The borrower is married and a mother of four children. They both live in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life among which are inadequate finances to increase her business and cater to her family's needs, sickness, death and accidents.

With this new loan requested, she will expand her business by buying manure, seedlings, medicine and a sprayer that she will use in watering her farm. In addition to that she will increase her farm size. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time. Furthermore, she has regular customers who buy her products - especially vegetables and spices that are always in high demand. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, the distance to buy from the market will be reduced, and vegetables also provide vitamins to the consumers.
 
With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, pay for her kitchen utensils and save some to meet the emergency needs of her family. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, and also because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. The social needs of members are also catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, sprayer and medicine.

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Cuc was born in 1984. She lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has four children. Her youngest child is learning at kindergarten and her other children are learning at primary school. Her husband is a carpenter. Cuc sells food to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for thirteen years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to sell food and the lack of money to pay for her children's education.  Her dream is to expand her business to have a better life in the future.  This loan is one of the steps to help her achieve this dream.  

Cuc is a hard-working and dynamic woman.  She has a passion for her job.  She said with this job she can make more money to earn a living and have time to take care of her family. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 10,528,000 VND and repaid on time. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 11,424,000 VND to sell food. She always wanted to expand her business, save profits for her children’s education and improve her family’s life. 

Other members who are part of Cuc's group include the following:
Hang is 28-years-old. She has three children. She sells plastic bags to earn a living. She wants to borrow 11,424,000 VND to sell plastic bags.
Ty is 32-years-old. She has three children. She sells plastic bags to earn a living. She wants to borrow 11,424,000 VND to sell plastic bags.
Thanh is 33-years-old. She has three children. She sells waterpipe tobacco to earn a living. She wants to borrow 11,424,000 VND to sell waterpipe tobacco.
Thuy is 29-years-old. She has three children. She sells plastic bags to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell plastic bags.

loans.use: to sell food.

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam de la ville de Koutiala qui se vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habillements, les cosmétiques, articles  divers, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. 
Adam est un membre du groupe assise au milieu  avec  ces produits cosmétiques savons et du bleu, elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des ingrédients pour faire du savon et du bleu. Elle se procure de ces produits au marché de Koutiala et effectue ses ventes en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110000  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Adam  compte réaliser  115 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The Benkadi Group is a group of women in the Darsalam district of the city of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 38 years old, married and have at least six children. This group of women sells a variety of goods, such as clothing, cosmetics, sundries, etc. To increase the size their businesses, the members of Benkadi Group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, where they are on their fourth group loan. 

Ms. Adam is sitting in the middle of the above photo with her cosmetic soaps and blues (a household product used for washing fabrics) around her. She plans to use her loan to buy ingredients to make soap and blue. She purchases these products at the market in Koutiala and makes her sales at home and in the market to a diverse clientele. While other members of the group have achieved an average profit of 110,000 FCFA this season, Ms. Adam expects to achieve 115,000 FCFA. In addition to repaying their loans, the women of the Benkadi group use a portion of their revenues for personal expenses and to increase the their businesses operating funds.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen operates a retail shop (all kinds of video and audio discs).He has a shop in his village, Kokoase (near Twifo Praso). Stephen is a single father with two children. As the sole breadwinner of the family, he uses his income to provide for the entire family. 

Stephen will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of different video and audio discs, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. As a Form 4 graduate, he understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus he plans to use the profits from his expanded enterprise to ensure that all his children remain in school and also to help his church.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of different video and audio discs

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANOU ont en moyenne  44 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TAMARO dans le cercle  de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANOU sont à leur 4 eme   prêt solidaire.AWA 1ere femme assise à  droite   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  100kg de poissons fumés, 5 kg d’oignons et 2 cartons de cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kanou Group have an average age of 44 years and 5 children. They all live with in traditional extended families in Tamaro in the San Cercle of the fourth administrative region of Mali. These women are related and conduct their businesses by buying and selling food products. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Kanou Group are now on their fourth group loan.

Ms. Awa is the seated at the right of the photo. She intends to use this loan to buy 100kg of smoked fish, 5kg of onions and 2 cartons of Maggi cubes. She sells her goods within the San Cercle to a clientele of both women and men, sometimes in cash but often on credit. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA to be used on a variety of health-, food-, clothing-, and school-related expenses. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI ont en moyenne  49 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à   Médine l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente d’habits, de condiments de savon  et des articles divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur 8 eme   prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 2eme femme de  la droite vers la gauche   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de savons. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sinignessigui Group have an average age of 49 years and four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of the city of San in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They are related to each other and have businesses selling clothes, condiments, soap and sundries.

Having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women of Sinignessigui Group are now on their eighth group loan. Ms. Djeneba is seated second from right in the photo. She intends to use the loan to buy ten boxes of soap, which she will resell in San to a clientele composed of women and men, sometimes in cash and often on credit. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which she will use on health-, food-, clothing-, and school-related expenses. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase soap

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BADEGNA ont en moyenne  44 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TENE dans le cercle  de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur 15 eme   prêt solidaire. BAKONI 2 eme femme de  la gauche vers la droite   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter vingt litres d’huile, deux sacs de 100kgs de riz, 8 kg de poissons fumés, 8 kg d’oignons et 4 cartons de cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Badegna Group have an average age of 44 years and five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the San Cercle town of Tene in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They are related to each other and operate businesses in the purchase and resale of food products. Having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Badegna Group are now on their 15th group loan.

Ms. Bakoni is the second woman from the left in the photo. She plans to use this loan to buy 20 liters of oil, two 100kg bags of rice, 8kg of smoked fish, 8kg of onions and four boxes of Maggi cubes. She will resell these products in San to a diverse clientele of women and men, sometimes in cash and often on credit. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which she will use on health-, food-, clothing- and school-related expenses. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Fayida Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FAYIDA ont en moyenne  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TOMINIAN chef lieu du cercle dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et vente d(habits et de condiments alimentaires.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FAYIDA sont à leur 2 eme   prêt solidaire. AISSATA 1ere femme assise à  droite   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 kg de poissons séché ,30 kg d’oignons, 20 paquets de cube Maggi  et 10 kg piments. Elle s’approvisionne à TOMINIAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Fadiya" group are on average 40 years old with four children and all live in large extended households in Tominian, the main local city in the fourth administrative of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling clothing and food condiments.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Fadiya group are on their second solidarity (group) loan. Aissata, the woman sitting all the way on the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 10 kg of dried fish, 30 kg of onions, 20 packets of Maggi cubes, and 10 kg of chili peppers. She gets her supplies in Tominian and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI  ont en moyenne  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KORO dans le cercle  de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI  sont à leur 6 eme  prêt solidaire. MAKOROBA 1 ère  femme à gauche   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 kg de poudre de poissons fumés de mer, vingt kg d’oignons séché, quinze paquets de cube Maggi, des pâtes d’arachide et du piment.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Benkadi" group are on average 32 years old with three children and all live in traditional extended households in Koro, in the San circle in the fourth administrative of the Republic of Mali.
These women know each other through family connections and run businesses buying and selling condiments.
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Benkadi group are on their sixth solidarity (group) loan. Makoroba, the woman all the way on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy 5 kg of powdered smoked ocean fish, 20 kg of dried onions, 15 packets of Maggi cubes, peanut paste, and chili peppers. She gets her supplies in San and makes her sales to a clientele comprising men and women, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for expenses relating to health, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente, tem 44 anos de idade, vive na casa própria, mãe de 4 filhos todos a estudarem, esta a repetir o crédito pela terceira vez, vive á base de negócio e conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: amendoim, açúcar, ovos, óleo, farinha, bebidas, etc, para reforçar o seu negocio que faz numa barraca em sua casa e como ambulante na estação de comboio da vila.
Ela tem a esperança de desenvolver mais o seu negócio, educar melhor seus filhos e construir uma residência condigna.
Seu maior desafio é estender mais o seu negócio, pois se encontra num nível ainda muito baixo para aquilo que é o seu desejo.
texts.en:
Regina is 44 years old and married. She lives in a house that she owns and has four children, all of whom study. She's currently on her third loan. Her means of livelihood is her business and she gets help from her hard-working husband.
With the loan she intends to purchase peanuts, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, flour, beverages, etc., so that she can boost her business. She runs her business from a stall in her house and as a street vendor at the village's railway station.
Her hope is to further develop her business, provide a better education for her children and build a decent home.
Her biggest challenge is expanding her business, since it's still at a very low level compared to where she wishes it would be.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, flour, beverages, etc., so that she can boost her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edite

texts.pt:
Jovem solteira, de 22 anos de idade, ainda sem filhos e sem dependentes, vive na casa que herdou dos familiares e é professora a pouco mais de 1 ano.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção: cimento, arrame, ferro, pregos, etc, para dar inicio á construção de sua casa.
Seu sono é poder ter casa própria, um carro e continuar com os estudos.
Diz não ter grandes desafios, apenas precisa de tempo para concretizar seus anseios.
texts.en:
Edite is a single young woman. She's 22 years old and still doesn't have any children or dependents. She lives in a house that she inherited from her family. She has been a teacher for a little over a year.
With the loan she intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, wire, iron, nails, etc., so that she can start building her house.
Her dream is to be able to own a car and a house of her own, and to continue her studies.
She states that she doesn't face major challenges, she just needs time to make her wishes come true.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, wire, iron, nails, etc., so that she can start building her house.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.pt:
Mãe viúva, de 26 anos de idade, tem 2 filhos 1 de oito anos a estudar e 1 sem idade escolar, é professora numa das localidades do Distrito e vive ainda em casa dos pais.
Com o crédito pretende comprar: cimento, areia, pagar mão-de-obra para dar inicio a construção de sua casa. 
Seu maior sonho é ter casa própria, continuar com os estudos e melhorar sua carreira.
Seu maior desafio é ter que ser mãe e pai de seus filhos sozinha, tendo ainda que estudar, trabalhar e construir.
texts.en:
Anifa is a widowed mother. She's 26 years old and has two children, an 8-year-old who studies and a one-year-old who hasn't reached school age. She's a teacher in one of the villages of the district and still lives with her parents.
With the loan she intends to purchase cement and sand, and to pay for labor in order to start building her house.
Her biggest dream is to own her own house, continue her studies and advance her career.
Her biggest challenge is having to raise her children on her own in addition to studying, working and doing construction work.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand, and to pay for labor in order to start building her house.

loans.name: Agya

texts.en: Agya sells women's accessories in Yabiw (near Takoradi). She is divorced with four children.As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the family. Agya will use the loan to purchase more earrings, bags, combs, mirrors, jewelry boxes, etc, to help expand her business and improve her overall sales. Agya understands the importance of education in improving social conditions,thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase more earrings, bags, combs, mirrors, jewelry boxes etc,

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: As a class three leaver, Esi prepares and sells cooked yam and serves it with vegetable stew. She lives in a village called Abaka Nkwanta in Twifo Praso, located in the central region. She is married to a wood contractor and has three children. She has been in this business for 3 years. She uses her profit to mostly support her husband to pay for her children's school fees. Esi plans on using her loan to purchase more yam and other ingredients for her food business, thus helping her sell more since her inventory will increase. She aspires to reinvest part of her profit into her business and also support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more yam and other ingredients for her food business,

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia sells secondhand handbags in Effia Kuma (near Takoradi). She has been educated through the end of middle school. She is a teacher. She has four dependents. 

Cynthia has been working in this enterprise for eight years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her secondhand bags business enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is a food vendor. She sells cooked rice, which is served with vegetables and meat stew. She sells to individuals around her locality, that is, Agona, Takoradi. She has been involved in this business for two years.

Gifty is married with two children (the picture shows Gifty and her two children). The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband (who is a mason) to pay her children’s school fees. 

She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity for education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, she sells vegetables like tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, cooking oil, etc., in Abrafo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for almost five years. 

She is married to a farmer and has three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees and utility bills.  

Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product.  Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty and also to set up her own shop

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling baby diapers and toilet rolls in Abrafo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. She is a widow without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of baby diapers and toilet rolls. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest part of her future profits into this business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands and the family in the long run.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of baby diapers and toilet rolls.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Rose did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming self-employed. Currently, she sells bananas with roasted groundnuts in Takoradi. She carries the bananas on her head and walk distances to make sales. She has been doing this for about ten years. She is married to a steel bender, and together they have three children. Rose uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of bananas and groundnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Rose wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to put up a fixed location for her business and also ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bananas and groundnuts to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza is married with one child. She received some schooling till the end of senior high school. Currently, she sells provisions in Takoradi. She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Her husband is a trader. Her income goes towards supporting her husband with the family's general expenses. Adiza will use the loan to increase her existing provision capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to help pay her child's school fees and develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing provision capacity.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana sells provisions (canned foods, sugar, detergents, Milo, etc) and soft drinks in Takoradi. She has been educated through junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Juliana has been working in this enterprise for two years. She helps her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her provisions and soft drinks enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business by selling in neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is a junior high school graduate. With no money to continue her education, she decided to go into the palm oil business at Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. She extracts the palm oil on her own and sells it to individuals and larger retailers. She has been in this business for about fifteen years.  She is married with six children. Adwoa took the loan in order to buy palm kennel and firewood in large quantities in order to aid in the expansion of her business. Because Adwoa is aware of her limitations due to her lack of education, she intends to use the profits to help her husband pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy palm kennel and firewood in large quantities to aid in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a junior high school graduate. She sells fried fish. She sells to individuals around her locality, Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for ten years.  Ekua is married to a farmer and they have seven children.  The income from her business normally goes towards helping her to pay her children’s school fees as well as general expenses.  She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish, oil, firewood and other ingredients for frying her fish. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity for education and also having a better location for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, oil, firewood and other ingredients to fry fish.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort specializes in selling plastic bowls in Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for ten years.  She is a junior high school graduate and is married with six children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping support herself and her extended family. Comfort wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory by buying more goods for sale, thus increasing the quantity of items like bowls and utensils in the near future. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands, help her children acquire the best of education and pay her utility bills.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory by buying more goods for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is divorced and has five children. Although she only had the opportunity to complete first grade, she is now an established businesswoman. She sells ‘kookoo’ (A Ghanaian recipe made of millet, pepper, ginger and other spices; usually taken as breakfast) in Twifo Praso.

She has been actively involved in this business for about eight years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Beatrice uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of millet, sugar and other ingredients, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to the changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase millet, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
After having the opportunity to graduate sixth grade, Janet decided to set up her own ‘Waakye’ business (Waakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She prepares her ‘Waakye’ and sells it in Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. 

With over five years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to the lack of funds. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Waakye’. 

She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their five children can attend school and experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Waakye’.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a seamstress in Twifo Praso. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She is married with five children. Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not complete her education. She had to drop out of the fifth grade, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of being an entrepreneur. 

Her income is mostly used to help her husband (who is a farmer) pay her children’s school fees and utility bills. She will use her loan to buy more materials for sewing in order to expand her business, thus allowing her to meet increasing customers.

loans.use: to buy more materials for sewing in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Charity Abena

texts.en:
Charity is a junior high school graduate. With no money to continue her education, she decided to start a palm oil business at Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. She extracts the palm oil on her own and sells it to retailers and individuals. She has been in this business for about eight years.

She is married with five children. Charity took the loan in order to buy palm kennel and firewood in large quantities, thus aiding in the expansion of her business. Because Charity is limited by her lack of education, she intends to use the profits made to ensure that all of her children are able to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy palm kennel and firewood in large quantities.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to unfortunate circumstances, Ama was forced to drop out of school during sixth grade. She sells smoked fish and cooked rice, which is served with tomato stew. She sells to individuals around her locality, Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for eleven years. 

Ama is married with seven children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband (who is a farmer) pay for her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to receive education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and other ingredients for the preparation of the food.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Although Beatrice did not have access to any form of formal education, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming self employed. She has decided to go into the palm oil business at Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. She extracts the palm oil, and then she sells it to retailers and individuals. She has been in this business for about fifteen years.  She is married with six children. Beatrice took the loan in order to buy palm fruit and firewood in large quantities in order to aid in the expansion of her business. Beatrice plans on using her profits to pay for her children's school fees, ensuring that they receive a solid education.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit and firewood in large quantities.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a junior high school graduate. She sells smoked fish to individuals around her locale, Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for four years. Esther is married with five children.  The income from her business normally goes toward helping her husband (who is a farmer) to pay for her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there is a growing demand among consumers for her food items. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, Esther aims to use her loan to purchase fish, tomatoes, salt, pepper, canned tomatoes, spices and other ingredients for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to receive education.

loans.use: to purchase fish, tomatoes, salt, pepper, canned tomatoes, spices and other ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua has attended junior high school, is married to a farmer and has two children. Currently, she sells secondhand clothing at Abaka Nkwanta in Twifo Praso (located in the central region). She has been involved in this trading for about six years now. Akua’s income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Akua will use the loan to increase her existing secondhand clothing capacity. With the new profits from her expanded petty trading, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing secondhand clothing capacity.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is married to a farmer. She has six children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses and save for a rainy day. Theresa sells hair extensions, mostly crochet for braiding hairs at Abaka Nkwanta in Twifo Praso. With over five years of experience in this trade, Theresa sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further but does not have the working capital necessary to increase her stock. Thus, the loan will be used to buy more hair extensions and weave on's, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Theresa wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. She plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions and weave on's.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame is a junior high school graduate. With no money to continue his education, he decided to go into the palm oil business in Twifo Praso. He extracts palm oil and sells it to retailers and individuals. He has been in this business for about seven years.  He is married with five children. Kwame took the loan in order to buy palm kernels, an extractor machine and firewood to aid in the expansion of his business. Kwame plans on using his profits to ensure that his children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy palm kernels, an extractor machine and firewood to aid in the expansion of his business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a chainsaw operator located in Twifo Praso. He has had some form of formal education, as he finished fourth grade. He is divorced and has one child. He has been cutting down trees for quite some number of years. His income is used to pay the utility bills and his child’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to purchase more chainsaws in order to fell more trees for wood and hire more workers, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand. He hopes to use the profits from his business to expand his operation further and ensure that his only child receives a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more chainsaws in order to fell more trees for wood and hire more workers, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: After graduating sixth grade, Ekua decided to set up her own Kenkey selling business (Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She prepares her Kenkey and sells it in Twifo Praso. With over six years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty Kenkey. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty Kenkey dish.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Even though Comfort grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she prepares and sells fried fish and Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She primarily sells her Kenkey in Twifo Praso. 

Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 18 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. Comfort has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her Kenkey. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Kenkey and fried fish. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Kenkey and fish dishes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a chainsaw operator and carpenter located in Twifo Praso. Due to difficult circumstances, he had to drop out of fourth grade. He is married and has 12 children. He has been in business for 12 years. His income is used to pay the utility bills and his children’s school fees. 

He plans on using his loan to purchase more chainsaws, wood and other carpentry materials, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand. He hopes to use the profits from his business to develop the business further and ensure that his children receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more chainsaws, wood and other carpentry materials, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Even though Felicia grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells Banku for a living. Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste, and is usually served with okra stew, groundnut soup, palm nut soup or pepper sauce. She primarily sells her Banku in Twifo Praso.  

Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began seven years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. Felicia has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her Banku. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicia wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty and receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Banku dish.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Due to unfortunate circumstances, Janet had to drop out of school in the fourth grade. With no money to continue her education, she decided to go into the agrochemicals business in Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. She sells her chemicals in a small shop made of wood. She has been in this business for about four years.  She is married with five children. Janet took the loan in order to buy in large quantities of fertilizers and other agrochemicals to aid in the expansion of her business. Because of Janet’s limited education, she is determined that all of her children finish school. Thus, she intends to use the profits made to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy in large quantities fertilizers and other agro- chemicals to aid in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a junior high school graduate. With no money to continue his education, he decided to go into agrochemicals trading in Twifo Praso; he sells in a small shop made of wood. He has been in this business for about five years. He is married with five children. Isaac took the loan in order to buy fertilizers and other agrochemicals in large quantities to boost his profits. He intends on using his additional income to ensure that all of this children are able to attend school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agrochemicals in large quantities to boost his profits.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Faustina did not have access to any form of formal education. However, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells maize in Twifo Praso. She has been doing so for fifteen years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have seven children. Faustina uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Faustina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education and also to get a fixed location for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a junior high school graduate. She sells smoked fish and cooking items. She sells to individuals around her locale, Twifo Praso. She displays her items on a table for resale on the side of the road. She has been involved in this business for over one year. Aba is a single parent with one child. The income from her business normally goes toward paying her child’s school fees, food and other expenses. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food items. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase fish, tomatoes, salt, pepper, canned tomatoes, spices and other ingredients for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her child will be given the opportunity to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase fish, tomatoes, salt, pepper, canned tomatoes, spices and other ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a junior high school graduate. She sells smoked fish to individuals around her locale, Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for four years. Rebecca is married with three children. The income from her business normally goes toward helping her husband (who is a farmer) to pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish and firewood to boost her sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and firewood to boost her sales.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a junior high school graduate. With no money to continue her education, she decided to go into the palm oil business in Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. She has been in this business for about five years. She is married with four children. Janet took the loan in order to buy palm fruit to process in bulk in order to increase her capacity. Janet knows the importance of education and will use her increased profits to ensure that her children are able to attend school.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit to process in bulk to increase the capacity of her pail oil business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Due to unfortunate circumstances, Ama was forced to drop out of junior high school. She buys from the bakery and sells to individuals around her locality in Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for five years. Ama is married to a farmer and they have three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers of her bread. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more bread to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to expand her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. She decided to go into the palm oil business in Pepekrom, Twifo Praso. She extracts the palm oil and sells it to retailers and individuals. She has been in this business for about five years. She is married to a farmer and they have six children. Abena took the loan in order to buy palm kernels and firewood in bulk to aid in the expansion of her business. Because Abena did not have access to education, she intends to use the profits from her business to help her husband pay for her children’s school fees so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy palm kernels and firewood in bulk to aid in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima  is a single mother of three children and none of her children goes to school.   She takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through rental rooms and selling piped water. 

Alima works from home seven days out of every week and sells retail.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves, and she aspires to become a wholesaler and also to   build more rental rooms.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of lower interest charged.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for the grandchildren and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi is married with six children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her aunt’s daughter).  She has a business selling airtime and mobile money services.
