She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more airtime and to load mobile money on her cell phone for mobile money service .  

Mayi works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells both wholesale and retail.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow to a fully stocked mobile phone shop. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer care. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more airtime and to load mobile money on her cellphone for mobile money service

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angella is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for months. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and fish.  She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they are cooperative.  She resides in a rented houses and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, school fees, feeding the family and electricity.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and fish

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a widow with five children; four go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda, mineral water, boxes of packed juices and biscuits.  She works at the market six days out of every week. 

Betty generates additional income from selling used clothes.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also buying a plot of land and building a house.  She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of low interest charged. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy  crates of soda, mineral water, boxes of packed juice and biscuits

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a single mother of five children and four of her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling tomatoes, onions and cabbages. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and cabbages. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation of boxes of vegetables from the villages to her stall and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and to start growing vegetables. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions and cabbages.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes. She sells her products on a door-to-door basis. She has been in this business for two years. She works seven days a week.  

Margaret has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second hand clothes for resale. Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season), which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring to get permanent business premises and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married with six school-aged children. She has one additional family member (mother). Susan operates a beauty salon from a market retail basis. She has been in business for 6 years and works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy hair treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids. A major business challenge is electricity, which hinders her business operations. She generates additional income as a mobile money agent.  Her aspirations include owning a bridal salon and having her children attend university.  She resides in her own house which has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more hair treatments,weaves,relaxers and braids

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

Mary is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more animal feed and vaccines.  Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to build more houses for her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vaccines

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is married to a driver. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school leaver, she currently sells slippers, shoes, and undergarments at Elimina, Cape Coast. With years of experience in this trade, Benedicta sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more slippers, shoes, and undergarments. She looks forward to boosting her overall sales. Benedicta wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, shoes, and undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresa is a hairdresser in Abura, Cape Coast. She is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Theresa uses her income to provide food and pay utility bills and other expenses for her family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of hair products such as hair extensions, hair pomade, hair relaxers, jewelry, etc. to expand her business, thus aiding her to improve her overall expenses. As a junior high school graduate, Theresa understands the importance of education in improving social conditions; thus, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair products such as hair extensions, hair pomade, hair relaxers, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado ella continua vendiendo granos secos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo y con la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y pollos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Margarita is grateful to all the lenders for the loan.  She is happy for the support given and she continues to sell dried grains such as barley and wheat, and raising small animals such as Guinea pigs, and chickens.  She needs a loan to buy Guinea pigs and chickens.  

Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial zone, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it hosts one of the seven wonders of the world, “Machupicchu.”

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nanibala

texts.en:
Nanibala is a 30-year-old housewife who lives with her husband Kalipada, aged 35 years, who earns money by driving a rickshaw which is not his own. It is a rented rickshaw. They have three children who are receiving an education. They live in Tekatuli village in the district Jalpaiguri.

Nanibala's husband's earnings are very low and it is difficult to maintain the family. Both of them decided to buy a rickshaw of their own. Anjali applied for a loan to help her husband to purchase a rickshaw. A rickshaw is a type of carriage using a bicycle which usually carries passengers from one place to another.  Nanibala hopes that her husband will earn more by driving his own rickshaw to carry people since he will not need to pay rent.

Their future plan is to buy more rickshaws, with the profit generated from this income. Other rickshaws would be used on a hire basis. The profit will also upgrade their financial condition and will help them to give better education to their children.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for carrying people.

loans.name: Protima

texts.en:
Protima is 43 years old.  She is a very energetic woman who is dedicated to her family. She has an animal husbandry business. She read up to class X (Grade 10). Her husband Mihir, 50 years, runs a small business polishing utensils. He received an education up to class X (Grade 10).  They have only one son who reads in college.

They live in their own semi-pacca (brick-built wall and straw roof) house at Bidhan Pally in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Protima and her husband work hard to meet the expenses of their family, but can't give enough support.  So, they thought to shift to another business.  Protima learned that BJS provides loans to rural women to do business.  So she applied for the loan to buy a cow to start her dairy products business making milk, curd, butter etc. She hopes to earn a profit from this business, as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market. This will give her additional support to run her family well.

She hopes that in the future, she will purchase more cows with the profit generated and will have a large dairy farm of her own.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a dairy products business.

loans.name: Anamika

texts.en:
Anamika is a 26-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband's name is Malay and he is 32 year old. Anamika studied up to class X (grade 10). Her husband is a young entrepreneur from a farming family and involved in agriculture. They have their own Kaccha (straw and mud made) house in the small village of SahaPara in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Anamika works hard every day, starting in the early morning. She also helps her husband in cultivation but she is unable to give financial support to her family, as the earnings of her husband are not sufficient to maintain their household expenses. She has applied for the loan to purchase paddy seeds and good quality fertilizers for growing potatoes on their land. This will help her to improve the financial condition of her family. Both Anamika and her husband dream of buying more land in the future with the profit they will earn from the business in order to make more income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali is a 52-year-old widow. She lost her husband long ago. She is an Arts graduate. Dipali has been selling clothes for many years. She started her business with a small amount of money provided by her husband.

She lives with her two children; one son and one daughter, in their own Pacca (brick build) house at Haspatal Para in the small town of Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She educates her children with great difficulty. One of them is pursuing a Bachelor degree in Arts and the other is at the University doing a Master's degree.

To meet the household expenses and the expenses of the education of her children, she needs a lot of money. But she cannot extend her business due to a lack of money. So, she applied for the loan from BJS to buy more clothes (sarees (Indian dress), frocks, shirts, etc.) from the wholesale market to sell locally. This business is profitable and is in great demand in their local market. 

She hopes the profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's education.

Dipali is thankful for the financial assistance she received from BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from the wholesale market to resell

loans.name: Jahanara

texts.en:
Jahanara is 42 years old, married and lives in the village of Khalai in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her two children and husband in their own semi-Pacca (brick-built walls and straw roof) house. Both Jahanara and her husband Makbul, 54 years old, are illiterate and can only sign their names. Makbul is a car driver by profession. Makbul's income is too low to run a family. So, to help with her family's finances, Jahanara decided to take a loan to purchase a cow and sell dairy products in the market. She has given preference to this business because, dairy products such as butter, milk, paneer, curd etc. are in great demand in her locality and in the present market. So, it is a profitable business. 

Selling milk and milk products will bring enough income to cope with the stringent financial condition their family is facing at present. She hopes in the upcoming days to buy more cows to start a dairy farm of her own and give their children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Gonenur

texts.en:
Gonenur is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have their own Kachha (mud and straw made) house. Gonenur and her husband Jalalluddin both passed Class V (Grade 5). Their daughter reads in Class V (Grade 5), one of the sons is a mason and the other is a carpenter.

Gonenur is engaged in animal husbandry. Her husband is a cycle-van puller. He earns money by carrying goods and people.  But their income is not sufficient to bear all the household expenses these days.

So, she plans to start her own business to give financial assistance to her family as well as to her husband. She learned about BJS and applied for a loan to purchase a cow to sell milk in the local market. She hopes she will earn a profit from this business, as there is a great demand for milk in their area. With the profit from her business, she will meet all the household expenses and her children’s educational expenses.

Her dream is to buy more cows and build a dairy farm of her own. She is very thankful for BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a dairy products business

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita, age 28, is a courageous lady from the village of Maynaguri .She lives with her husband Bikash who is a farmer. They have two children. Sangita studied up to class X (grade 10). They send one of their children to school. They want their kids to lead a very successful life with a good education.

It was difficult for them to manage the minimum day-to-day expenses of the livelihood of her family. So Sangita decided to start her own grocery shop, but due to a lack of funds, it was very difficult for her. Then she heard about BJS and decided to take a loan to purchase a variety of groceries for her grocery shop.  

In the future, she dreams of extending her business and give a good education to their children.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Momina

texts.en:
Momina is a hardworking woman. She is only 22 years old and a housewife. She is the mother of three children; two sons and one daughter. They are 5 years old, 4 years old and 13 months old, respectively. Her husband is Kaodar, 22 years old. Momina passed Class V (Grade 5) and her husband passed Class VII (Grade 7). They live in the small village of Kholai in the small town of Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own Kachha house (mud and straw made). 

Her husband is engaged in agriculture. It is the main source of income with which they meet the household necessities. They have their own small piece of land. Some of this land they have purchased, some they have inherited from their parents. But the income from the cultivation is not sufficient to run such a big family now -a-days.

She applied for a loan from BJS to start a business cultivating tomatoes. With the loan, she wants to buy good quality tomato seeds and fertilizers. These will help her to achieve the goal that she and her husband have set and they will be able to sell their harvest at a good price in the local market.

Momina hopes to be able to increase the amount of cultivation on the land and get her children ahead. She wants to prepare them academically so that they will be ready for tomorrow and have many opportunities and options in their life.  

In the future, her dream is to make build a Pacca house (brick-built) with the profits she earns from her business.

loans.use: To purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Najima

texts.en:
Najima is a 21-year-old housewife. She is the mother of two daughters. Her husband Nur is 31 years old and a farmer by profession. Najima and her husband both passed VI standard (Grade 6). One of her daughters receives an education in Class I (Grade 1). The other is a child of three years.

They live in their own Kachha house (mud and straw made) in the small village of Kholai, in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

To make a living, Najima's husband has been farming on their own small plot of land for many years and supplements their family's income. But the current business does not provide them with enough money to cover their family's needs. Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and family.  She wants to start her own business cultivating potatoes on their own land and selling those potatoes in the local market. She has given preference to this business because potato cultivation is a very profitable business in their area. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

She hopes this business will enable her to improve her standard of living. She wants to purchase a car cycle van to use to carry vegetables in the market and to rent for further income.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Lyova

texts.ru:
Лёва родом из Грузии, там он работал строителем, но с каждым годом все труднее было прокормить семью. Несколько лет назад он семьей решил переехать на Украину в с.Водяное. Здесь он стал осваивать сельское хозяйство, учился у родственников как выращивать овощи. С каждым годом бизнес растет и сейчас у него уже есть несколько теплиц. 

В прошлом году Лева воспользовался КИВА кредитом для усановки отопления. При этом он понял, что на то количество теплиц, которое у него есть нужен более мощный котел. Лева просит предоставить ему кредит 30,000 гривен для покупки более мощного отопительного котла для своих теплиц. Это поможет ему раньше высадить рассаду и продать урожай по более выгодной цене.

У Лёвы большая семья, четверо детей, сейчас уже две дочери на выданье, поэтому он старается как можно больше  сил и средств вкладывать в хозяйство,  чтобы  помочь детям начать самостоятельную жизнь.
texts.en:
Lyova was born in Georgia. He worked there as a builder but with every year, it became harder and harder to feed his family. Several years ago, he and his family decided to move to Ukraine to the village of Vodyanoye. Here he began studying agriculture and learned from his relatives how to grow vegetables. Every year, his business grows and now he has several greenhouses already.   

Last year, Lyova used a Kiva loan to install a heating system. That being said, he understood that for his quantity of greenhouses he would need a more powerful heater. Lyova is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 hryvnia to buy a more powerful boiler heater for his greenhouses. This will help him to plant his seedlings earlier and sell his harvest for a better price. 

Lyova has a big family with four children. Now two of his daughters are of marrying age, which is why he is trying with all of his strength and finances to invest in his business in order to help his children start their own, individual lives.

loans.use: purchase and install a more powerful heater for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena mayor de edad madre soltera con dos hijos aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, y donde existe uno de los ingenios más grandes del país, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de comida como: sopas de gallinas con albóndigas, sopa de res con punche, sopa de Mondongo, carne en vaho tres veces por semana, al igual que mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros, sus compras las realiza en mercados de otros municipios al igual que en distribuidoras de su localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera semanal, inicia su  negocio como una forma de subsistencia para su familia. En la actualidad ha obtenido logros y ha podido mejorar su vivienda poco a poco logrando darles un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, luchadora con muchos deseos de superación personal. El objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general y de compra de productos de consumo para realizar sus deliciosas comidas, y de esa manera brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.-
texts.en: María Elena is of legal age and is a single mother with two children who are still economically dependent on her. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the western area of the country, where the main economic activities are related to commerce. It is also where one of the most ingenious people lives, a small business woman who sells food such as: chicken soup with meatballs, beef soup with crab, tripe soup, and steamed meat three times per week. She also sells general merchandise, such as: clothing, shoes, and plastic products, among other things. She makes her purchases in markets in other cities and also from distributors in her town. She does her sales on cash and on credit for repeat customers and new ones. She charges them each week. She started her business as a form of subsistence for her family. She has achieved much and has been able to improve her house bit by bit, providing her children with a dignified roof. She is a very hardworking woman who fights to get ahead and has a great personal desire to succeed. The purpose of this loan is for working capital to buy general merchandise and to buy ingredients to make her delicious foods. In this way she will be able to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as: beef, chicken, tripe, cassava, malanga, peppermint, plantains, crabs, and onions, among others; also a variety of styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and plastic products.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanessa 24 años de edad casada con un hijo menor de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora que lucha día a día para salir adelante, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, chinería, adornos, entre otros al igual que vende también leña, reposterías como: pasteles de queso, carne, piña, tortas de leche, prisioneros, maletas entre otros los cuales las realiza por encargos, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los que recupera semanal, inicia su negocio por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar,  uno de sus sueños es poder ver a su hijo terminado sus estudios siendo un profesional. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de variedades estilos de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos, entre otros y así cubrir con pedidos que tiene.-
texts.en: Karla Vanessa is 24 years old. She is married and has one young child in her charge. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is an enterprising woman who works hard every day to get ahead. She is a small business owner who buys and sells general merchandise, such as: a variety of styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and house decorations, among other things. She also sells firewood and bakery items, such as: cheese cakes, meat, pineapple, milk cakes, “prisioneros,” and “maletas,”among others. She makes them when people place orders for them. She makes her sales on cash and on credit for return customers and for new ones. She charges them weekly. She began her business due to the necessity of helping with the household costs. One of her dreams is to see her son finish his studies and become a professional. The purpose of this loan is to buy a variety of styles of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes, among other things and cover the orders she already has.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise and ingredients for her delicious bakery items.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь уже много лет занимается выращиванием высокорослых помидор, огурцов и также выращивает рассаду на продажу. Вначале Игорь с друзьями нанимали машину и возили свою продукцию в Россию, на заработанные средства покупал землю, строил теплицы. Сейчас ему уже не нужно ехать далеко, теперь покупатели приезжают к нему домой, есть и постоянные покупатели. За эти года Игорь приобрел хороший опыт, его продукция отличается качеством и  этим  он гордится.
 
Но этот год для Игоря стал не удачным. Осенью прошлого года он провел отопление во все теплицы и на это потребовались большие вложения. Весной, когда все было посажено, обнаружилось, что он приобрел не качественные шланги. В результате первые четыре кисти на помидорах были потеряны, а от них основная прибыль. Поэтому Игорь в первый раз обратился за кредитом.  На полученные средства  он планирует приобрести новые шланги от надежного производителя, а также купит пленку и семена. «Я благодарен за возможность получить помощь для моего бизнеса». Игорь надеется исправить отопление и получить замечательный урожай в этом сезоне.
texts.en:
For many years already, Igor has been in the business of growing determinant tomatoes and cucumbers, as well as growing seedlings for sale. At first, Igor and his friends rented a car and transported their products to Russia. With the earned money, he bought land and built greenhouses. Now he doesn't have to travel as far, as customers come to meet him at his house. He has loyal customers. Over the last few years, Igor has gained a lot of experience. His crops are of an especially high quality and he takes pride in them.  
 
However, this year, Igor has been unlucky. In Autumn of last year, he installed heating in all of his greenhouses. He made a big investment in this. In the Spring, when everything has been planted, it became apparent that he had bought poor-quality tubing. As a result, the first four clusters of tomatoes had been lost, and with them, his main source of profit. This is why Igor is for the first time applying for a loan. With the received loan, he plans to buy new tubes from a reputable manufacturer as well as buy a plastic cover and seeds. "I am grateful for the opportunity to receive assistance for my business." Igor hopes to fix the heating system and receive a wonderful harvest this season.

loans.use: to purchase heating tubes, plastic covers and seeds for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Miguel Mauricio

texts.es: Miguel es un ingeniero de sistemas que, a sus 35 años de edad, por dificultades económicas y por falta de oportunidades laborales, decidió emprender su propio negocio para generar ingresos que le permitieran salir adelante; fue así como surgió la idea de adquirir una pequeña franquicia de bebidas energizantes, la cual compró con unos ahorros que poseía y, además consiguió personas que le colaboraran en la distribución del producto en la calle; desde entonces ha logrado estabilizar nuevamente sus finanzas; adicionalmente y, como una alternativa para complementar los recursos que percibe; él también vende productos y mercancía por catálogo y sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside. Su empuje, dedicación y perseverancia lo han llevado a triunfar sobre las adversidades que se le presentan en la vida, especialmente aquellos relacionados con la falta de capital para trabajar dignamente. Actualmente solicita su primer ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, relojes, ropa, entre otros), de esta manera podrá abastecerse con una buena variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa con la llegada de la temporada decembrina; con esto podrá lograr mejorar el nivel de ingresos que recibe y, con los que Miguel puede seguir avanzando para que en un futuro a mediano plazo pueda cumplir el sueño de tener su propio almacén de venta de mercancía fusionado con un café internet; ya que ve en ambas actividades, una potencial fuente de ingresos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 36 years old, is a systems engineer who due to lack of funds and work opportunities, decided to launch his own business to generate the necessary income to get ahead. So with his savings he bought a franchise of energy drinks. He organized people that helped him to distribute samples of the product to the public, and from that point, he was able to balance his finances.

As an additional source of income, Miguel also sells merchandise by catalog to some of his key costumers, relatives, friends and neighbors. His dedication and perseverance allowed him to succeed despite the struggles that he faced, specifically in relation to the lack of investment capital to work.

He is now requesting his first loan, with which he plans to buy stock merchandise (like perfumes, body lotions, make up, watches, clothes, and more), in order to have a variety of items to meet customers’ requests during the holidays. In this way, he will increase his income to be able to accomplish his middle-term planning objectives, among them,  his dream to launch his own shop to sell his merchandise, a shop that can also be an internet cafe point. He would like to combine these two activities because he identified great potential and demand in both, which would greatly benefit his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise (like perfumes, body lotions, make up, watches, clothes, and more).

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana es una madre soltera de 35 años de edad, que se ha dedicado durante muchos años a trabajar en el campo de la confección a terceros; inició en un taller que manejaba en compañía de su suegra, pero lamentablemente su novio y padre de su primer hijo falleció violentamente y, desde aquel entonces la relación entre su suegra y ella no fue la mejor, por lo que decidieron dividirse el capital de trabajo y los equipos de confección; fue así como surgió su pequeña microempresa con la que ha generado los recursos económicos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su familia y solventar todos los gastos del hogar.  Su empuje, perseverancia y su actitud emprendedora y dinámica le han permitido sobrepasar diversas crisis que se presentan en el sector, debido a la gran competencia que existe para confección a terceros; sin embargo, esto no la desmotiva para seguir luchando cada día. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar una máquina recubridora, que le permita agilizar el proceso de producción, dando como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que percibe por esta labor. Diana sólo desea continuar trabajando arduamente para que, en un futuro pueda tener su propia marca de producto y así dejar poco a poco su trabajo de confección a terceros, pues en la actualidad este gremio posee mucha competencia y la producción es pagada a muy bajo coste; así ella puede disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Diana, 35 years old, has worked  several years in the tailoring business. She first got involved in this field working in a sewing shop that she ran with her mother-in-law. Unfortunately, her boyfriend -who was also the father of her first son- died tragically, and from that point, the relationship with her mother-in-law was never the same. Hence, they decided to split the business’ capital and the equipment.

This is how Diana launched her own small sewing shop, which is the main source of income that allowed her to provide for her family and cover the household expenses. Her efforts, her perseverance and her entrepreneurial  spirit combined, helped her to handle different challenges, as there is a lot of competition in this field of work. Despite the competitive atmosphere, she doesn't  feel discouraged and she continues to strive every day.

She is now requesting a loan with the purpose to buy an industrial sewing machine, which would help her to increase productivity and as a result,  her income. Diana wishes to continue to work hard, to have her own line of clothing in the future and enjoy a higher quality of life and well being for her family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Wence

texts.es:
Wence de 56 años de edad, desde muy joven se a dedicado al trabajo, no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres no tenian la condición económica para  darle el  estudio, todos sus hijos viven con él; ya que la mayoría están pequeños y los mayores van a la escuela de la comunidad en primaria.

Wence se a dedicado a trabajar todo su vida en la agricultura, ya que su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y siendo el único barón de la familia tenia que ayudarle a su padre en el cultivo de maíz. Luego  se caso y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta para su familia, también trabaja como jornal ayudandole a cuidar unos animales bovinos y a comprar y vender pescado, esta actividad la hace todos los días y vende de casa en casa, en la época agrícola cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitado, es para comprar animales de granja cerdos y la compra de concentrados para la alimentación de estos. 

Él  espera sacar adelante a sus hijos con el estudio hasta donde sea posible, también espera un futuro construir una vivienda; ya que actualmente esta viviendo en casa ajena y quiere construir para su familia.
texts.en:
Wence, 56 years old, began to work at a young age, and he wasn't able to study because his parents didn't have the economic means to offer an education for him. All of Wence's children still live at home with him, as they are quite young, and the older ones are studying in the community’s school.

Wence has worked in agriculture throughout his life, as his father was also in this field, and because he was the only male from the siblings, he had to help his father to cultivate corn. Once he married, he continue to work on his own, for his family. In addition, he performs daily jobs tending cattle, or buying and selling fish. He does these jobs on a daily basis and then sells the products from his own home. During the harvesting season he grows corn in a field of 7,000 sqm.

The loan that he is requesting now will be to buy farm animals (like pigs) and animal feed. Wence wants to support his children’s education as much as possible. He also hopes to be able to build a home in the future, as they currently rent and he wants to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm animals (like pigs) and animal feed.

loans.name: Patricia Ernestina

texts.es:
Patricia de 39 años de edad, logro graduarse de profesional en la rama de docencia, es una mujer  muy trabajadora, esforzándose todos los días para poder llevar el sustento a su familia. esta acompañada y su pareja de vida es comerciante de frutas y verduras, tienen tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando de 8:00am hasta 12:00md.


Patricia trabaja como profesora en la Escuela de Educación Especial, se a dedicado a esta profesión desde hace 13 años, para sacar esta profesión tuvo que trabajar en una librería, para pagarse los estudios. Para acudir al trabajo, tiene que trasladarse 12 km.  Trabaja de lunes a viernes y se traslada en bus. En la tarde cuando los niños vuelven de clases, los cuida su esposo, este solo vende frutas y verduras en la mañana.


Patricia necesita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda, la casa con que cuenta se encuentra en mal estado. Hace poco tiempo la adquirió, porque ella vivía y trabajaba en otro lugar, pero por conservar el trabajo tuvieron que venirse a vivir donde están actualmente, esta casa la adquirieron a bajo costo, pero requiere de mucha inversión y no cuentan con el dinero suficiente, lo que les a obligado a solicitar el crédito.

Al tener los recursos podrán hacer las mejoras respectivas y tendrán condiciones mas adecuadas para vivir y tendrán tiempo para ir abonando al crédito sin tener que descuidar las necesidades básicas de su familia.


Su sueño, es poder establecerse bien donde vive actualmente, teniendo una vivienda digna para su familia; que sus hijos puedan estudiar  y crecer en un ambiente sano, sin tener que estar trasladándose de un lugar a otro.
texts.en:
Patricia, 39 years old, obtained a degree in the field of education, and she is a very hard working person who works every day to provide for her family. She lives with her husband –who sells fruits and vegetables- and with her three children, who study every day from 8:00 am to noon.

Patricia works in the School of Special Education; she has been in this field for the last 13 years. Prior to that, she worked in a library to cover her tuition fees. She works from Monday to Friday and she travels by bus 12 kilometers every to get to work. In the afternoons, when her children are back from school, her husband takes care of them, as he only works during the mornings.

Patricia is requesting a loan to improve her home because it is bad conditions. They moved to this house recently, as she used to live in a different area, but in order  to continue to have a job they bought this house for a very low price. However, the house needs a lot of repairing and they currently lack the resources to do so. 

For this reason, they are requesting this loan, because it will allow them to make the necessary improvements to the house, making living conditions more satisfactory for the family, while continue to provide the basic needs of the household.

Patricia’s dream is to settle up well in their current house, to be able to offer a suitable home to her family and that her children may study and grow in a healthy environment, without having to relocate from one place to the other.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, es soltero, tiene un hijo, vive junto a su hijo en una casa familiar, no posee ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a sembrar granos básicos, es una actividad que realiza desde muy joven y la aprendió de su familia, por su experiencia no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en realizarla.
Compra plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono y herbicidas, que son los insumos necesarios para preparar la tierra y sembrar sin problemas. Espera mejorar su producción, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos para cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con mejorar su cosecha, tener un economía estable que le permita seguir aportando para los gastos de su casa y darle a su hijo lo una oportunidad de superación académica.
texts.en:
José is single and has a partner.  He lives with his son in the family home and does not receive help from anyone abroad.  José makes a living sowing basic grains, work that he has been doing since he was very young.  He learned this trade from his family and, because of his experience, has not had any difficulty carrying out this work.

José will buy anti-plague treatments, insecticides, manure, and herbicides, which are all necessary for preparing his land and sowing his crops without any problems.  José is hoping to improve production, increase his sales, and increase his earnings so as to pay off this loan.

José dreams of improving his harvest, of having a stable financial situation that will allow him to continue helping with household costs, and of giving his son the opportunity to have a better education.

loans.use: to buy anti-plague treatments, insecticides, manure, and herbicides.

loans.name: Francis Yamilhet

texts.es:
Doña Francis con siete años de experiencia en cultivar y producir café forma parte de una familia compuesta por su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, 2 niñas las cuales estudian en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y un varón el mayor que estudia en secundaria y al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles apoya a sus padres en el campo. La fuente de sus ingresos en la producción y cosecha de café y dan gracias a Dios por trabajar lo propio de manera que en su parcela de tierra tiene cosechado café uva la cual es comercializado con los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto. Como otra fuente de ingresos es también la elaboración de pan donde sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos siendo el método de venta por medio de pedidos. Con sus 34 años de edad su grado de estudio es de primaria incompleto el cual curso hasta el 4 grado ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo y su hijo mayor trabaja es propia la cual una parte está ubicada a 200 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual fácilmente se trasladan caminando. 
Sus sueños poder ampliar sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor variedad de producto como el caturra, el lempira, el nance etc. y poder ofrecer a los diferentes clientes e intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Como madre para sus hijos poder apoyarlos en sus estudios y lograr que ellos puedan prepararse académicamente de una mejor forma para poder tener mayores oportunidades en la vida, y mejores ideas de negocio. Por lo que ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual quiere comprar insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y así al final de esta temporada lograr obtener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
With seven years of experience growing and producing coffee, Francis is married - her husband works in farming - and has two daughters, both of whom are in primary school.  She also has a son in secondary school and he supports his parents in the field when he is not in school.  Francis' income comes from growing and harvesting coffee.  She thanks God that she has her own work.  Francis has her own plot of land where she grows the coffee, which she then sells to the various buyers who come to the region in search of a good product.  Francis also makes bread in order to earn another income.  In this case, her customers are neighbours, relatives, and friends, for whom she makes bread to order.  At 34 years old, Francis only completed up to fourth grade of primary school as her parents were very poor and could not support her. Francis owns the land that she, her husband, and their son work.  It is some 200 metres from their house, and so they can get there easily on foot.

Francis's dreams are to expand her coffee crops and sow a variety of coffee beans, such as Caturra, Lempira and Nance coffee, and to offer her products to different customers and wholesalers who come to the area.  As a mother, Francis wants to be able to support her children with their studies, and give them a better, academic education, so that they will have better opportunities in life and better ideas for businesses.  

Francis is applying for a loan from COMIXMUL in order to buy farming supplies to help her coffee plants so that, at the end of the season, she will have an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee plants.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Tayipa Kame Group

texts.es: Marisol es la lideresa de Banco Tayipa Kame un grupo de 9 mujeres indígenas de la zona de Talamanca en Limón. Su nombre está escrito en su dialecto indígena y significa “Mujeres Trabajando”. Marisol tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 niños. Ella hace dos años y luego de una capacitación en el área de costura se dedica a confeccionar ropa a la medida. Este es su segundo crédito y se siente muy motivada, ya que ha encontrado la manera de contribuir con los gastos familiares,  y tener independencia económica. Está nueva inversión será para la compra de una máquina de coser para mejorar la calidad de sus prendas y agilizar la producción. Doña Marisol tiene muchos sueños pero objetivo a mediano plazo es acondicionar un cuarto de su casa para convertirlo en un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en: Marisol is the leader of the "Tayipa Kame" bank, a group made up of nine indigenous women from the Talamanca area of Limón.  The group name is written in the women's indigenous language and means "Working Women".  Marisol is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  Two years ago she did a training course on dressmaking and now works making clothes to order.  This is Marisol's second loan and she is feeling very motivated as she has found a way to contribute to household costs and to have financial independence.  This new investment will be used to buy a new sewing machine in order to improve the quality of her clothing items and to speed up production.  Marisol has many dreams but her medium-term objective is to convert a room in her house into a dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Ruth Group

texts.es: María es la tesorera  de Banco Mujer Ruth, tiene 38 años, es viuda desde hace 3 años, y tiene un hijo de 11 años, estudiante de primaria. Estos últimos años han sido muy difíciles para ella, luego de  la pérdida de su esposo, y tener que hacerle frente a todos los gastos de su hogar. Pese a todo esto esta mujer tan valiente y emprendedora, supo sacarle el mayor provecho a su actividad productiva, que es el comercio de forma ambulante, vende; Joyería, perfumes y ropa. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita, y lo va a invertir en la compra del tipo de mercadería mencionada, y prepararse para la temporada navideña que aumentan sus ventas. Los más importante en este  momento  para ella es superar la crisis económica que afronta, y consolidar su negocio, siendo el financiamiento una buena herramienta para lograrlo. Junto a ella conforman el grupo 8 integrantes más  que van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Maria is the treasurer of the Ruth Women's Bank. Maria is 38, has been widowed for three years and has an 11 year old son who goes to primary school. These last few years have been very difficult for her; apart from the loss of her husband, she has also had to cover all the household expenses. In spite of everything, this very brave and enterprising woman has been able to make the most out of her work as a travelling saleswoman selling jewellery, perfume and clothes. 

This is the second loan that Maria is applying for. She will invest it in the purchase of the aforementioned items to prepare herself for the Christmas season, which sees an increase in her sales. The most important thing for her right now is to overcome the financial crisis she is faced with and establish her business, and this loan will be a great way to achieve this. Aside from Maria, there are eight other group members who will invest this loan in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase jewellery, perfume and clothes to resell

loans.name: José Nicolás

texts.es: José, con 30 años de edad, ha sido comerciante independiente durante toda su vida productiva. Vivía en otro país latinoamericano donde tenía un supermercado y con el dinero que generaba podía enviar dinero a Colombia para el sustento de su esposa y su pequeña hija. Pero, por dificultades de salud que su esposa comenzó a tener, tuvo que regresar al país para hacerse estar pendiente de ella, quien está en embarazo y para cuidar a su pequeña hija; ya radicado en la ciudad, decidió montar un negocio para seguir generando recursos económicos, inició con una legumbrería en la que trabaja solo todos los días de la semana y, actualmente desea incursionar en el campo de la venta de comidas rápidas, razón por la que solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar un carrito de perros y surtido al por mayor para ambos negocios (verduras y frutas, panes, carnes frías, salsas, queso, gaseosas, entre otros),  con lo que podrá tener bien abastecido su negocio y dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo con el que aumentará la entrada de recursos económicos. José manifiesta que desea seguir trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante sus negocios y, en un futuro poder cumplir su principal sueño que es montar una microempresa de venta de helados y así lograr una mejor rentabilidad que le permita brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 30 years old, has always worked as an independent entrepreneur. He previously lived in another Latin American country, where he opened up a grocery store and sent money to his family in Colombia, supporting his wife and young daughter. However, due to the fact that his wife had some health complications, he returned to his country to take care of her during her pregnancy. 

Once he settled back in his city, he opened up a business of fruits, vegetables and  legumes, where he currently works every day of the week. Now, he also wishes to go into the field of fast foods, and for this reason he is requesting this loan, to invest in both businesses by buying a hot dog cart, bread, cold meats, salsa, cheese and soft drinks among other. 

This would allow him to stock well his business and begin the new venture, increasing his income. Jose wants to continue to work as hard to make his businesses succeed, and in the future, achieve his dream of opening up an ice-cream micro-enterprise, and offer a better quality of life for his family and well-being to his children.

loans.use: to invest in both of his businesses by buying a hot dog cart, bread, cold meats, salsa, cheese and soft drinks, among other.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: Don Manuel es originario de la ciudad de Nandaime, Carazo, padre soltero de tres hijos ya independientes. De 41 años de edad. Es de oficio transportista y guarda de seguridad, se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al transporte de moto taxis. Negocio que inicio hace pocos años, trabajando como guarda de seguridad en un colegio. Luego renuncia, y con el dinero de la liquidación decidió comprar una moto y de un préstamo completo lo que le faltaba para la compra. Poco a poco se fue incorporando en las zonas rurales ofreciendo el servicio de moto taxi. Actualmente cuenta con su moto el cual le ha generado buenos ingresos. Su meta es darle un mejor aspecto a su moto. Solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento y reparación a su moto taxi, con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será muy beneficioso ya que podrá brindar una mejor comodidad y atracción a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá una alta demanda. Su plan futuro es mantener y dar un mejor servicio seguro a todos los pasajeros.
texts.en:
Manuel, 41 years old from Nandaime, Carazo, is a single father of three children, who are now grown up. He works in transportation, in the business of moto-taxis, which he began a few years ago while he was still working as a security guard in a school. When he left that job, he used the settlement compensation that he received, and combined with a previous loan, he was able to buy a moto-taxi. 

Slowly he has been able to work offering his services in rural areas. He is now requesting a loan to improve and repair his vehicle, in order to offer better services to his clients. 

Manuel anticipates a lot of benefits from this loan, as offering better comfort to his customers will also increase his clientele. He plans to continue to offer competitive and safe services to his passengers.

loans.use: to improve and repair his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, trabaja como agricultor en una pequeña parcela que tiene desde hace 10 años, y la cual le ha permitió cultivar diversos productos  con los cuales ha podido salir adelante, asimismo trabaja como albañil y tiene una pequeña ladrillera con lo cual tiene ingreso extra para poder solventar los gastos de su familia.

Omar está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá implementar mejor su ladrillera, especialmente podrá construir pozas, y comprar materiales para la elaboración de ladrillos, con lo cual podrá mejorar su negocio y poder luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una empresa constructora”:
texts.en:
Omar lives in the city of Aguaytia, and he works as a farmer in a small land that he acquired 10 years ago, where he grows different types of crops, an activity that helped him to get ahead in life. In addition, he also works as a stonemason, running a small brick business, which supplement his income to cover the family expenses.

Omar is thankful to Kiva lenders because thanks to this support he will better establish his brick business, specifically he will be able to build ponds and buy materials to make bricks, improving his business and striving towards achieving his big dream: to own a building company.

loans.use: to invest in his brick business.

loans.name: Zoila Merida

texts.es:
Doña Zoila a sus 56 años de edad ha luchado por muchos años para conseguir alcanzar sus metas, conseguir sus propósitos y hacer realidad sus sueños. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora casada y madre de 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno de pende de ella pero ambos ayudan en las diferentes actividades de campo que se llevan a cabo para mantener sus cultivos de café sanos, y protegidos de heladas y plagas. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa la cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo por parte de sus padres a pesar de su corta economía. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad ya que desde muy temprana edad ella empezó a trabajar en compañía de sus padres y junto a su esposo tiene 25 años de ejercer tal actividad. La tierra que en familia trabaja es propia la cual está ubicada a 30 minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación a la cual en familia se dirigen para asistir.
Ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la compra de urea, abono, foliares para asistir sus cultivos de café y una nueva cantidad de plantilla para poder cultivar y obtener una mejor producción de café. 
Sus metas son poder adquirir las nuevas plantillas de café que desea comprar para poder ampliar sus cultivos de café y obtener al final de cada temporada una buena producción obteniendo mayores ganancias para re invertir en su propiedad y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 56 years old, has always worked hard to achieve her goals and dreams. In addition to being a homemaker and taking care of the house work, she also is a farmer, a wife, and a mother of two. She supports only one of her sons, but both help her with different tasks in the field, taking care of the coffee plantations, protecting them from pests and from the cold weather. 

Her highest level of education achieved was elementary school, which she was able to complete thanks to the effort and support from her parents, despite their economic challenges. 

Zoila has a lot of experience in agriculture, as she began helping her parents with the coffee plantations at a very early age, and she has been doing this work with her husband during the last 25 years. The fields are owned by her family, and are located about 30 minutes from her house.

Zoila is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies like compost, mulch and urea (a nitrogen-release fertilizer) for her crops, and improve her coffee production. Her goals are to buy coffee seedlings to grow her business, have a productive harvesting season, increase her revenue and to re-invest in her property, strengthening the family activity for her sons.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and coffee seedlings to continue with the family business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
After graduating from senior high school, Elizabeth decided to set up her own provisions and pastries business in Elimina, Cape Coast. With some few years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she has small working capital.

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more canned drinks, Nido, Milo, flour, sugar, etc., for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a welder) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more canned drinks, Nido, Milo, flour, sugar, etc., for resale

loans.name: Bernard Kojo

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Bernard decided to set up his own retail shop selling television stands, compact discs and video discs. He has been doing this business for quite some time now and he plans to increase his inventory due to a growing number of customers.

Unfortunately, he has a limited amount of income.  As a result, this loan will be used to help him purchase more television stands, digital video discs and compact discs for resale. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more television stands, digital video discs and compact discs for resale

loans.name: Docas

texts.en:
Docas is a junior high school graduate. She prepares and sells ‘fufu’ (a traditional Ghanaian food made of cooked cassava and plantains which is pounded into smooth round balls), served with light soup, palm nut soup and groundnut soup with fish /meat. She sells to individuals around her locality, that is Elmina. She has been involved in this business for some years. 

Docas is married to a petty trader and they have four children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping pay her children’s school fees. 

Docas has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantains and other ingredients for the preparation of her food. With the new profits from her expanded business, Docas wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to an education.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantains and other ingredients for the preparation of her food.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Hawa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a petty trader. Currently, she owns a grocery shop at Abura in Cape Coast. She has been doing so for sometime now. 

Hawa is married to a driver, and together they have three children. Hawa uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of canned foods, sugar, flour, etc., which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Hawa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of canned foods, sugar and flour

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta owns a small provisions store located in Elmina. She has had some form of formal education as she is a senior high school graduate. She is married to an auto electrician and they have three children. Roberta has been selling provisions for quite a number of years. Her income is used to support her husband in paying the utility bills, for food and her children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive a quality education.

loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of provisions,  thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demands.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a rural woman of 41 years. She is married to Nur Islam, who is 49 years old. They are both illiterate and can only sign their names. They have two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom go to school. One is in Class XII (Grade 12) and the other is in Class X (Grade 10). They have their own Pacca house (brick built) at Joldhaka in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

Saira's husband Nur is a green grocer. He is very tenacious and dedicated to his job. Saira is also trying to help her family financially. She works very hard. She has an animal husbandry business with which she covers some home expenses and her childrens' educational expenses. Yet, Saira and Nur are unable to meet the increasing expenses of their family.

Saira came to know about BJS, and that BJS gives loans to rural women to start business of their own. So she applied for this loan, with which she will buy a cow and start a dairy products business, producing items such as milk, butter, paneer, and curd. She wants to sell them in the local market. There is a great demand of these products in the local market. Her main interest is to continue fighting for her family's well-being, which is why she will continue to work hard in order to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a business of selling milk and dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with four children. She received some schooling until the end of her junior high school education.

Currently, she sells children’s wear, plastic bowls and cooking utensils in Elimina, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this business for some years now. Her husband is a trader. Joyce’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. She will use the loan to buy more children’s wear, Dettol, baby diapers, silverware, plastic bowls and other items.

With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Joyce plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to buy more children’s wear, Dettol, baby diapers, silverware, plastic bowls and other items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casado y tiene 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de lucha de la pareja. Él se dedica al servicio de flete y construcciones ya hace mas de 10 años, trabaja en forma familiar con sus dos hijos, cabe destacar que también realiza trabajo de herrería en su domicilio.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas, para poder usarlas en las construcciones que hace, lo que le permitirá trabajar de una mejor manera. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Juan is a local of the city of Encarnación, married and father of four children, who are the main reason for the couple to fight. He has been working in freight services and construction for over 10 years and has the help of his two sons. He also does some forge work at home. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase wood and use it in his constructions, which will allow him to improve his work. He is grateful for the opportunity that will help him to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy wood for construction.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste) and cooked rice with stew. She sells her ‘Banku’ at Abura, Cape Coast.

As her husband is currently unemployed, her earnings are entirely used to support their five children. She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for some years. Alice plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of maize, cassava and other ingredients, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity.

She aspires to use her profits to both better market her ‘Banku’ enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of maize, cassava and other ingredients

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Due to unfortunate circumstances, Clifford had to drop out of school in fourth grade. He then decided to get into the palm oil business in Elmina. He is married with six children and his wife is a farmer.

Clifford extracts the palm oil and retailers, as well as consumers, come to buy from him. He took the loan in order to buy palm kernels and firewood in bulk, as well as an extractor machine, to aid in the expansion of his business. 

Because of Clifford’s lack of education, he intends to use the profits to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy palm kernels and firewood in bulk, as well as an extractor machine, in order to aid in the expansion of his business.

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a housewife and is blessed with four children: two sons and two daughters. Her husband Ratan, age 41 years, is engaged in potato cultivation on their own small land. They both received no education and can only sign their names. Three of their children receive education; they read in class VII (Grade 7), class III (Grade 3), and class II (Grade 2). The fourth is below school-going age. They live in the small village Saatvendi, in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own Kachha house (made of mud and straw).

Milan's husband's income is not enough to meet their household expenses and their childrens' educational expenses. She learned about BJS and applied for a loan to buy seed potatoes and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes on their own land. She is very hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable as there is a great demand of potatoes in the local market. So, she is very motivated to give her full effort to her cultivation business.

Her dream is to buy a cycle van in future for their use and rent it for another means of income.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seed potatoes and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena, who is 25 years old, lives in a rural area, Dhupguri, in the district Jalpaiguri. She is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter.  She is a housewife and is educated to class VII (Grade 7).  Her husband Nazrul, aged 25 years, received education up to class V (Grade 5).  Only one of their children goes to school and reads in class II (Grade 2).  They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. They have a kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).

The main source of income for the family is the agricultural activities by Meena's husband.  Meena is also very hard-working. Besides managing all the household works, she helps her husband by working hard in the agricultural activities. Yet they face a great difficulty in affording the cost of the food expenses and other necessities for their family.

Meena chose BJS for this loan as she wants to purchase good quality seed potatoes and start cultivating potatoes. She hopes to harvest more crops so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living, as this product has a good demand in the local market and it can be a very profitable business too. She will also be able to provide good education to her children with the profit generated from this business.

Meena's future plan is to buy a plot of land to generate more income.  She is very much thankful to BJS as well as to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seed potatoes and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pravabati

texts.en:
Pravabati is a 43-year-old married woman from the small village of Bengkandi in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband Ramesh and four children (two sons and two daughters). Both Pravabati and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are receiving education. Their two sons are in class XI (Grade 11) and class VIII (Grade 8), and the daughters are in class XII (Grade 12) and class VI (Grade 6).

The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where rice is usually grown. She and her husband work hard and always have high quality rice, which is sold to local retailers. Pravabati needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. So, she has applied for the loan from BJS to buy good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers.
      
She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members and especially her children have a better education and better future.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, age 29, and her husband, Hazrat, age 29, are from a small town Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. They have three children and all of them are studying in school. Amina has completed her education up to class VI (grade 6) and her husband has also completed his education up to class VI (grade 6). 

Amina is a homemaker. Her husband is associated with the potato cultivation business but the profit from this business is not sufficient. To help her husband in his business Amina decided to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer to grow more potatoes and sell them in the local market. Due to lack of money, she applied for a loan. This business can be profitable for them, as her husband is experienced in this business and there is lot of demand for potatoes in their locality. 

Amina's future dream is to make a "pakka" house (concrete house) as now they live in a "kachha" house (house made of mud and straw). She wants to secure her children’s careers by earning good profit from this business. She is very happy to become a member of BJS and thankful to Kiva for funding her loan as she was very much in need of it.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking 36-year-old housewife in the small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Subal and they are raising two sons together. They do not have a concrete house; they live in a kacha house (house made of mud, bamboo, straw). Anita sends her two sons to school. One is in class V (grade 5) and other is in class IX (grade 9). 

Anita's husband is engaged in the agricultural business, but his income is not sufficient to meet the household expenditures and the educational expenses of their sons. Nowadays the price of essential goods is rising vigorously. To cope with the present situation, it has become necessary to generate more income. So, housewives are also coming forward to help their husbands and family financially. Likewise Anita has come forward and started her own business of making Daler Bori (balls made of lentils, used in Indian curry dishes). She prepares Daler bori in her home and sells them to the local grocery shops. 
 
She wants to increase her business as well as her profits, so she needs more financial resources. She came to know about BJS from her neighborhood, and learned that BJS gives loans to poor women for their businesses. Thus she applied for a loan to purchase the ingredients for preparing Daler Bori: dal (lentils), spices, grains etc. 

In the future she wants to build her own concrete house and give a better lifestyle to her family members. She gives hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing Daler Bori (lentil balls) to sell to the local groceries.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, 27 years old, is a married housewife.  She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband, Manu, who is 37 years old, is  a farmer. They live with two children in their own kaccha (mud and straw-made) house in the small village of East Alta Gram in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.  They give education to one of their children with great difficulty. That child is in class I (Grade 1), and the second one is too young for school. It is very difficult for them to meet their household expenses and their child's educational expenses. 

Sabita learned about BJS and applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes in their own land. She is very hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable as there is a great demand for potatoes in the local market. So, she is motivated to give her full effort to expand her cultivation business.  Their dream is to build a pacca (brick-built) house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a 22-year-old housewife. Her husband, Fajirul, aged 27 years, is a farmer. They have three children (two sons and one daughter). Their children are receiving an education. Their two sons are in class VI (Grade 6) and class VII (Grade 7) and their daughter is in class III (Grade 3). They live in their own kaccha house (mud and straw-made).

The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activity. They have a plot of land where usually potatoes are grown.  Manju and her husband work hard and always have high quality potatoes, which are sold to local retailers. As the income is only seasonal, the earning is not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle and the expenses of their children's education. Manju needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. So she has applied for this loan from BJS to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

Manju also hopes her business will ensure that her family members and especially her children have a better education and a better future. Both husband and wife desire to buy a cycle van in future for their own use and rent it out for another means of income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of personal care items, aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a provisions seller as well as a seamstress at Taterem, Elmina, She has had some formal education as she is a senior high school leaver. She is married to a plumber and they have four children.

Vida has been selling provisions for quite some time now. Her income is used to help her pay the utility bills, and her children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased amount of biscuits, Milo, milk, bags of rice, sugar, and sweets, etc  thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of biscuits, Milo, milk, bags of rice, sugar, and sweets

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity owns a restaurant (locally called chop bar) in her village. She is a middle school leaver. She prepares and sells ‘fufu’(made of cooked cassava and plantains pounded into smooth round balls), ‘banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste), and cooked rice which is served with tomato stew and fish /meat. She sells to individuals around her locality, Ataabadze which is located in Elmina district. She has been involved in this business for some years.

Charity is married to an agric officer and they have three children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there is growing demand among consumers for her food. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice, cassava, plantains and other ingredients for the preparation of food. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charity wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cassava, plantains, etc., for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Currently, Mary sells foodstuffs, vegetables, salt, Gallic, rice, Maggi cubes and spices in Elmina. She is a junior high school graduate. Her business has grown substantially since she began some years ago. 

Mary is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her foodstuffs and vegetables. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Mary decided to sell ladies' clothing. She displays her clothes in a round aluminum pan and walks distances to sell them in and around Elmina. With quite a number of years' worth of experience, Mary is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding.

 As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more clothing, thus enabling her to prepare to meet customer needs. Mary aims at using the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a carpenter) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a baker in her village. Due to unfortunate circumstances, she had to drop out of school in fourth grade. She bakes bread and cake. She supplies them to retailers both near and far, as well as to individuals around her locality, Elmina. 

Vida is a single parent with four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her pastries and bread. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited capacity.
