Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to receive education and further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery.

loans.name: Mensah

texts.en:
Anastasia is a hairdresser in Elmina. She is married to a petty trader and they have one child. She uses her income to help her husband   provide food, pay utility bills, and cover other expenses for her family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of hair extensions, hair pomade, and hair relaxers to expand her business, thus aiding her to improve her overall receipts. 

As a junior high school graduate, Anastasia understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair extensions, hair pomade, and hair relaxers for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of millet, sugar and other ingredients, helping her improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua specializes in selling corn and cassava dough. She has been involved in this business for a long time. She is a single mother with two children and a junior high school graduate. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping support herself and her extended family.

Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory and make more dough for sale, by buying more maize and cassava for her dough.

In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands, helping her two children get the best of education and pay her utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more maize and cassava, increasing her current inventory by making more dough for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Mary decided to sell ladies wear. She displays her clothes in a round aluminium pan and walks distances to sell in Elmina. 

With quite a few years' experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more underwear, slippers, dresses etc for resale, thus enabling her to meet customer needs.

Mary aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a carpenter) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life. She also wants to put up a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear, slippers, dresses etc for resale

loans.name: Leomaldy

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Leomaldy  en su miscelánea, con su crédito obtuvo un mayor capital de trabajo para comprar útiles escolares ropa juguetes y mercancías sobre pedidos, que ocasionaron un incremento en sus ventas e impactaron positivamente sus utilidades.  Sus ingresos familiares fueron superiores por eso ella dice  a sus financiadores de Kiva “Estoy muy agradecida con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por haber fortalecido mi negocio, “Gracias a ustedes”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará juguete, calzado, ropa y  mercancía variada, para dar respuesta a la temporada de fin de año, que se avecina con mucha demanda y Leomadys necesita estar lista para responder haciendo de su credikiva una inversión productiva.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Leomaldy and her general store. Her loan provided Leomaldy with more working capital to purchase school supplies, clothing, toys, and various other items that customers had ordered. These developments increased the store's sales, Leomaldy's profits, and her family's income, so she'd like to tell Kiva lenders, "I'm very grateful to Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for making my business stronger. Thank you." 

Leomaldy is now applying for a new loan, and will use the loan funds to purchase toys, clothing, footwear, and various other items to prepare for the approaching year-end holiday season, when demand always increases. Leomaldy needs to be ready for the season, and to turn her Kiva loan into a productive investment.

loans.use: to purchase toys, footwear, clothing, and various other items.

loans.name: Anjuma

texts.en:
Anjuma is a 24-year-old married woman. Her husband Mazibul is 39 years old. They are from the small town of Mayanaguri in Jalpaiguri. They have three children, of whom two are studying and the other is too small to go to school. 

Anjuma is a home maker and her husband is associated with an agricultural business. Her husband’s income from his business is not enough to run their family smoothly, so she decided to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes as they have their own vacant land that is near their home. They used to cultivate different types of seasonal vegetables on their land, but due to lack of money they are unable to grow their business. Therefore she has applied for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for cultivating potatoes. She hopes it will help her husband in making more profit for her family. They chose this business because potatoes are a demanded vegetable in West Bengal and they are used in many Indian dishes.

Her future dream is to purchase more land by making good profit from her business. She is a hardworking woman. They live in a Kachha house (made of mud and straw), but they want to make a Pakka (concrete) house for themselves and want to give higher education to their children. She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Yorledis

texts.es:
Yorledis  de 29 años de edad tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 8 y 11 años. Su negocio, con el cual sostiene su hogar, consiste en la elaboración y venta de almuerzos, actividad que desempeña desde hace 10 años, cuando aprendió de su madre, quien se dedicaba a esta misma actividad y por novedades en su familia lo cerró. 
2 meses después yorledys y su hermana indagaron entre sus vecinos sobre la necesidad de reiniciarlo y la respuesta de estos, sus primeros clientes,  fue muy positiva y hasta hoy tienen 4 años de estar dedicada a la venta de almuerzos, comidas corrientes y especiales, que elaboran mediante pedidos de sus clientes, que son empleados de carpinterías, contratistas, y vecinos del barrio. Sus compras las realizan en el mercado de la ciudad, donde encuentran precios ajustados a sus requerimientos y muy competitivos y sus ventas las realizan de contado todos los días trabajando desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. Su meta más adelante es ubicar su restaurante en un local aparte de domicilio, con el fin de disfrutar de un mayor sosiego familiar y ganar mucho más, para lograr que sus hijos estudien una carrera profesional. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para alcanzar sus sueños rápidamente, pero con mucho esfuerzo y ganas de triunfar poco a poco piensa lograrlos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primero financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  6 juegos de mesas con sus respectivas sillas,  una carpa, la cual es muy útil para protegerse del sol del Caribe y la lluvia, con esta inversión dará una mayor presentación a su negocio y brindará un ambiente confortable en una temporada donde se incrementan las ventas y la demanda de consumo inmediato en la mesa también, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Yorledis is 29 years old and has two children, aged eight and eleven years old.  Yoreldis has had a business making and selling lunches for over ten years.  The business provides an income for the household.  Yoreldis learned this trade from her mother.  She also had a business like this but closed it due to family circumstances.

Two months after closing the business, Yoreldis and her sister asked around the neighbours to see if there was a need to reopen it.  Their response, and the responses of their first customers, were very positive.  The sisters have now been selling lunches and simple and special meals for four years.  They make the food to order.  Their customers are workers, who have jobs with carpenters, contractors, and in the neighbourhood.  Yoreldis and her sister buy the goods they need in the city market.  There they find the prices they need, which are very competitive. They buy in cash every day, working from 5am until 2pm.  Yoreldis' goal is to have their restaurant on premises separate from their home, so that the house will be more peaceful, and so that they can earn a lot more and pay for her children to study at university.  Yoreldis' biggest challenge is that she does not have enough working capital to achieve her dreams quickly.  Nevertheless, with a lot of effort and the will to to do well, she is gradually reaching her goals.  

Yoreldis is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation.  She will use this loan to buy six sets of tables and chairs, and an awning in order to protect her customers from the rains and the Caribbean sun.  With this investment, Yoreldis can improve her business' image and provide her customers a comfortable place to eat during this season when sales and demand increase, making her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy six sets of tables and chairs, and an awning.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es: Don Erasmo, tiene 73 años de edad, es soltero por viudez, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. El siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Su actividad de negocio es la venta de nieves (hielo molido con jugo, miel o leche condensada) estos helados los vende de manera ambulante movilizándose en una carretilla. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita el octavo ciclo y es por 5,000 Lempiras, para reparar su carreta donde vende helados. Su meta es incrementar las ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Erasmo is a 73-year old widow man who lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. He has always worked in retail. His business activity is the sale of sorbets (powdered ice with juice, honey or condensed milk) using a wheelbarrow as a street vendor. 

He has requested several loans for his business. He is now requesting his eight cycle for 5,000 HNL to repair his wheelbarrow. His goal is to increase sales and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his wheelbarrow, which he uses to sell sorbets.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a baker in her village. She is a form four leaver. She bakes bread and cake, and supplies them to retailers both near and far, as well as individuals around her locality, Elmina. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. 

Vida is a single parent with four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her pay her children’s school fees.

She has noticed that there is a growing demand among consumers for her pastries and bread. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients for the bakery.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to get an education, to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Eric did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped him from achieving his dream of becoming an entrepreneur. He is currently a barber in Essuekyir. He has been involved in this business for some years.

Eric is single and has three children. He uses all his income to feed and provide for his family. 

Eric will use the loan to purchase large quantities of combs, hair creams and other supplies which will help him to improve his business. He wants to use the future profits from his expanded business to ensure that all his children are able to receive a better education.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of combs, hair creams and other supplies which will help him grow his business

loans.name: José Naún

texts.es:
José es un joven  de 22 años de edad,  que estudio noveno grado, por situaciones económicas no pudo seguir estudiando, en la actualidad está acompañado; se dedica a la agricultura junto a su compañera de vida, viven los dos en casa de los suegros. 
 

José se dedica 100% a la agricultura siempre lo ha hecho, con sus papas el trabajo de sembrar maíz, maicillo y plátano. Por lo que, conoce bien la actividad que realiza; hoy tiene el apoyo de su compañera de vida. 
 
El préstamo solicitado a fundación campo, es para comprar los insumos para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de plátano con ello comprara la semilla,  pagara la preparación de la tierra y el abono; por lo que no es suficiente él complementaria lo que le falte, porque tiene unos 200 racimos de plátano que ya casi están de venta, con ello piensa que debera menos e invertirá más y estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de producir  plátano.  

El sueño de José, es que en el corto plazo poder construir su casa propia, al sacar la cosecha para así tener la privacidad que necesitan y también irse proyectando tener una familia.
texts.en:
José is a 22 year old young man who went to school through the ninth grade. Due to financial situation, he was unable to stay in school. Right now, he is in a common law marriage. He works at agriculture with his life's companion. They live in his parents in law's house.  
 
José works 100% in agriculture and he has always done so. He grew corn, sorghum and plantains with his parents. Because of this, he knows his activity very well. Today he has the help of his life's companion.
 
The loan he has asked Fundación Campo for is to buy materials to plant 7,000 square meters of plantains. With it, he will buy the seeds, pay for the soil preparation and for the fertilizer. If it isn't enough, he will pay for anything else he needs himself, because he has about 200 bunches of plantains that are almost ready to sell. This way, he thinks he will owe less and invest more and be filling the need of producing plantains. 

José's dream in the short term is to be able to build his own house when he gets the harvest because that way, they will have the privacy they need and also get started on their family.

loans.use: to buy materials to plant 7,000 square meters of plantains, buying seeds, paying to prepare the soil and for the fertilizer.

loans.name: Prembala

texts.en:
Prembala is a 53-year-old widow, raising her two children. She is a rural resident. She lives in the small village of West Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri. She lost her husband few years back. She is engaged in milk supply business to look after her children and meet the expenses of her family. 

Prembala is illiterate and can only sign her name. She lives in their kachha house (mud and straw-made) with her two sons. One of her sons receives education and studies in class XII (Grade 12).  The other is a day labourer.

Prembala has a milk supply business, and it is admirable that she is able to do that along with maintaining her household work.  But nowadays, when the prices of essential goods are increasing day by day, it is impossible for her to run her family well with her small income. She wants to buy one more cow to expand her business. 

She came to know about BJS and about microfinance loans, and applied for a loan from BJS to buy one more cow. She hopes it will help her to develop her business which will generate extra income to meet the financial needs of her family and give better education to her children.

She also hopes to set aside the extra profit to make a dairy farm of her own.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to expand her existing  business selling milk and dairy products in the market

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Mary decided to set up her own second hand clothing shop in Pedu, Cape Coast.

With a few years’ worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more second hand clothes for resale.

She aims to use her profits from the expanded business to help support her husband (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life

loans.use: to help her purchase more second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a trader who sells foodstuffs like yam in Abura, Cape Coast. She is married to a petty trader and has two children. Her income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Afia will use the loan to purchase large quantities of foodstuffs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

Since she was forced to leave junior high school due to lack of funds, Afia understands the importance of education in improving social conditions. Therefore, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her two children remain in school to avoid poverty and have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of foodstuffs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is married with four children. She has a middle school education. Currently, she sells maize, beans, groundnut and yams at Abreshia, located in the elmina district. She has been involved in this business for some years now. Her husband is a herbalist. Helena’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Helena will use this loan to increase her existing maize, beans, groundnut, and yam capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Helena plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to increase her existing maize, beans, groundnut, and yam capacity

loans.name: Karla Aida

texts.es:
Karla de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, hoy tiene cinco años de estar acompañada, su esposo es mecánico. Él trabaja este oficio desde que tenía ocho años de edad en un taller con sus abuelito, pero hoy quiere independizarse y trabajar propio, sus hijas de 4 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, todavía no van a la escuela hasta el otro año asistirá una de ellas.  

Karla se dedica a los oficios domésticos y por momentos le ayuda a su compañero de vida, en el taller; ya que su misión es también aprender la mecánica, el pequeño taller lo tiene en su casa en la comunidad.

El  préstamo solicitado a fundación campo, es para  comprar Equipo básico de trabajo como lo son llaves, micas, aparatos de detección de problemas para los carros modernos y otros, aprovechando la experiencia que tiene el compañero de vida y así estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de tener lo necesario para desarrollar  bien su trabajo.

El sueño de Karla, es ver en su  casa un taller mecánico donde las personas de su comunidad, se sientan satisfechos y seguros de llevar sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Karla is 20 years old and has a ninth-grade education. She has been married for five years to a man who works as an auto mechanic. The couple have two daughters, ages two and four. Neither child goes to school, but the older girl will enter school next year. 

Karla's husband has done auto repairs since he was eight years old, working in his grandfather's shop, and now wants to go into business for himself. The couple has set up a small repair shop in their home. Karla works in the family's home, but also helps her husband at the shop sometimes, and wants to learn to repair cars. 

Karla has applied for a loan from the Campo Foundation to purchase basic equipment such as keys, auto accessories, and devices that diagnose problems in new and older cars. This loan will allow Karla and her husband to use his experience and be sure that they have the tools they need to grow their business. 

Karla's ambition is to to have an auto repair shop in her home that will satisfy her neighbors and make them trust Karla and her husband with their vehicles.

loans.use: to purchase basic equipment such as keys, auto accessories, devices for diagnosing problems in new and older cars, and other tools.

loans.name: María Carmen Silvia

texts.es: María, a sus 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, inició vendiendo diversos productos de manera ambulante en las calles de la ciudad, actividad que aprendió de una amiga que también realizaba esa labor. Hace 14 años, se le presentó la oportunidad de tomar un local en un pasaje comercial del centro de la ciudad que es muy reconocido por el amplio comercio de libros de todo tipo y, desde entonces comenzó a vender estos productos, trabaja sola de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm y así genera los recursos suficientes para sustentar las necesidades de su familia, ya que toda la carga económica recae sobre ella. Ella encuentra en su labor, la ventaja de no tener que rendir cuentas a otras personas y que puede manejar su propio tiempo, pero debe afrontar la desventaja de no tener los beneficios de las prestaciones sociales. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (libros académicos, de literatura, novelas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de fin de año y la de la temporada escolar del próximo año, en la se incrementan sus ventas, generando mayor rentabilidad e ingresos económicos. María manifiesta que su principal interés es poder cumplir el sueño de tener su negocio en un local mejor ubicado, pues actualmente está en un segundo piso, por lo que en algunas ocasiones tiene inconvenientes para vender los libros; sin embargo ella sigue luchando incansablemente, pues aspira a ver sus hijos graduarse de la universidad y lograr que sean personas íntegras y exitosas.
texts.en: María is 39 years old. She is the single mother of 3 children and a head of household. During her productive life she has worked as an independent merchant. She started by selling different products as a street vendor in the city streets. She learned that activity from a friend who also did that kind of work. Fourteen years ago, the opportunity came up to have a locale in a hallway full of retailers in the city center. It is very well known for the sale of a wide variety of books of all types. She has been selling this type product since then. She only works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and in this way she generates enough resources to fulfill her family's needs, since all of the financial responsibility is on her. In her works she finds that there is an advantage in not having to be accountable to other people  and that she can manage her own time. However, she faces the disadvantage that she doesn't have the benefits of social services. Right now, she is asking for the loan to invest in buying merchandise wholesale (textbooks, literature, novels and more) to stock up enough to fill the end of the year demand and the next school year. This is when her sales increase, generating more profits and income. María says that her main interest is being able to make her dream come true of having her business in a better locale, because right now she is on the second floor. Sometimes that is inconvenient for selling books. Nonetheless, she keeps fighting tirelessly because she aspires to seeing her children graduate from college and become honest and successful people.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (textbooks, literature, novels, and more).

loans.name: Agnes Ekua

texts.en:
Agnes is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Agnes is a successful businesswoman. She sells products such as rice, sugar, and gari in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast Castle). She has been actively involved in this business for about nine years.

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Agnes uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of grocery products, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a trader and has four children. As a single mother, she uses her income to pay for the household expenses as well as to save for a rainy day.

As a form one school leaver, she currently sells provisions at Abreshia, located in the Elmina district. With over three years of experience in this trade, Cecilia sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the necessary working capital to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more biscuits, canned foods, drinks, soap, detergents and other products, so as to boost her overall sales.

Cecilia wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, canned food, drinks, soap, detergents and other products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Esther decided to set up her own grocery business in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). 

With over nine years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of financial resources. Therefore, this loan will be used to help her purchase more groceries such as rice and maize for resale. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a mason) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: by purchasing more groceries, such as rice and maize, for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling stew in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Ama is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of ingredients, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of stew. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of ingredients, allowing her to sell greater quantities of stew

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Yaa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough which is wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for four years. 

Yaa is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Yaa wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Yaa plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells fried fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. Abena is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fried fish. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fried fish

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es: Nancy Guadalupe agradece a los inversionistas por préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta cosméticos como por ejemplo cremas, perfumes entre otros y continua perteneciendo al banco comunal "Liderando las Palmeras" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cosméticos como por ejemplo aretes, pulseras, billeteras, pintalabios para esta campaña navideña que se esta acercando, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Nancy Guadalupe is grateful to the investors for the loan and she is happy with the support that has been given. She keeps selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes and more. She also still belongs to the "Liderando las Palmeras" communal bank. At this time, she needs the loan to buy cosmetics such as lipsticks, and earrings, bracelets, and wallets for the coming Christmas season. She is grateful to those who have been a part of this dream and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as lipstick, and earrings, bracelets, and wallets.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo anterior y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella sigue vendiendo productos naturales a base de hierbas que son útiles para la salud, ella también sigue trabajando en un consultorio dental. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos naturales.
texts.en:
Bernardina is grateful to investors for her previous loan and is pleased at the support provided. She continues selling natural herbal health products. She also continues working in a dental office. She has had her business for several years and it is going very well.

At this time she needs another loan in order to buy natural products.

loans.use: to purchase natural products.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 46-year-old housewife and there are seven members in her family, her parents, three children and her husband. Her husband Jakir is 51 years old.  Rabia attended school up to class IV( Grade 4), whereas her husband Jakir is illiterate and can only sign his name.  Two of their two sons are receiving an education.  They read in class IX (Grade 9) and class VI (Grade 6).  Their only daughter is still a child below school-going age.

They have their own kachha house( straw and mud-made) at Barosoria in the small town of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

They are from a humble family of scarce economic resources, which is why Rabia's husband cultivates different crops in their own small piece of land.  He has been working in agriculture for many years and produces beans, onions and other vegetables for the family's consumption and sells some of his produce in the local markets.

The small income of Rabia's husband is not sufficient to get past the financial hurdles of their family, so she decided to start cultivating potatoes in their land. For this she needs capital, which they do not have, so she applied for this loan from BJS for purchasing potato seeds and fertilizers.  She hopes the profit which will be generated from their new business will meet the financial needs of their family as well as helping her to give her children better education.

Rabia hopes to upgrade their kachha house to a pacca one (made of concrete) in future.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a married woman with two small daughters.  She is a rural housewife who is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband Rabi is 45 years old. He is also illiterate, and a carpenter by trade.  One of their daughters receives an education. She reads in class III (Grade 3). The other daughter is a child, below the school-going age.

They live in their own house which is kachha (straw and mud-made) that does not have electricity.  They live in the small town of Madhyapara in the district Jalpaiguri.

Sabita's greatest expenses are food and the educational expenses of her daughter, which she cannot cover with her husband's small income. She decided to start a potato cultivation business of her own, but to start a business she needs capital.

Sabita heard about BJS and she applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers, with which she will start cultivating potatoes and sell them in the local market. She hopes to earn a good profit as it is a profitable business and has a great demand in their locality and in the present market.

She hopes that the profits from their business will ensure her family members, especially her children, a better education and a better life.

She is thankful to BJS as well as to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and good quality fertilizers to start a potato cultivation business.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, su grado académico es de 3° grado. Es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad; su esposo viajo a los Estados Unidos, pero no se acuerda de ellos, sus dos hijos estudian en el centro escolar de la comunidad cerca. Para ello le ayuda el papá de ella quien tiene 74 años, pero tiene un trabajo fijo como jornalero eso le permite poder ayudar.

María su fuente de ingreso depende del negocio de pupusas, que hace por las tardes en un puesto a orilla de calle de la comunidad, donde se reúne los habitantes a recrearse.  Así aprovecha de hacer el negocio, el negocio lo emprendió por la necesidad de llevar el sustento a sus hijos, el trabajo lo hace tres horas diarias.  

El préstamo solicitado a fundación campo, es para comprar una vaca parida, con el objetivo de sacar la leche y alimentar a sus hijos y también poder vender algo de sus producto, para cambiar la alimentación y con eso estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de poder alimentar mejor a su familia. 

El sueño de María, es en el corto plazo poder construir un local propio, para dejar la cocina en el lugar de trabajo y no cargar con ella todos los días. Como también cree que puede darle una educación a sus hijos para que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
María is 31 and has a third-grade education. She has been a single mother of two children, ages 8 and 6, since her husband left for the United States and forgot about the family. María's two children study at a school in a nearby town, and María's 74-year-old father, who still has a steady job as a day laborer, helps pay their school fees. 

Maria earns income from her business selling pupusas [tortillas filled with cheese, pork, chicken, or beans], which she prepares in the afternoon at a stand on a street in her town where residents gather to relax. María thus took advantage of the opportunity to start a business because she needed a way to provide for her children. She works seven hours a day.  

María has applied for a loan from the Campo Foundation to purchase a calf. The animal will produce milk for her children and that she can sell, meeting her need to provide a better diet to her children. 

Maria's short-term goal is to build her own home and be able to work in her kitchen instead of working from a stand. María also believes that she can ensure that her children can get an education and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Even though Hannah grew up in poverty without education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. She is currently in the food business, preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) and gari for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ at Abreshia in the Central Region.

Hannah uses the income from her business to help her husband (herbalist) to raise their four children. Hannah has realised that there are growing demands among consumers for her ‘Kenkey’. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Therefore, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, leaves and other ingredients, helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of maize, leaves and other ingredients.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for a number of years. Efua is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries, in order to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a small scale grocery seller in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she attended school until leaving in middle school due to lack of funds. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mechanic.

Esi has been selling groceries for close to six years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an more groceries, allowing her to meet increased customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to ensure that all of her children are able to attend school.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, thus allowing her to meet increased customer demand.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education Ama is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, aiding her to improve her overall sales.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Esi decided to set up her own ‘Kenkey’ and “Banku” selling business (Kenkey and Banku are traditional Ghanaian staple dishes that are made from corn or cassava dough and eaten with stew or soup). She prepares her ‘Kenkey’ and ‘Banku’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). 

With over ten years' experience, Esi is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’ and ‘Banku’. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a carpenter) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’ and ‘Banku’.

loans.name: Johanna Josefa

texts.es: Johana es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de comida (nacatamales etc.), el cual con mucho entusiasmo ha salido adelante. Esta agradecido con Kiva y Micrédito ya que le ayudo a diversificar los platillos que ofrece y a incrementar la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: maíz, papas, tomates, carne de cerdo, cebolla, arroz, entre otros con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá un alto nivel de ganancias para realizar una remodelación de su local y su vivienda.
texts.en:
Johana is a native of Managua and runs a business selling food, such as nacatamales [a Nicaraguan dish similar to a tamale: corn meal, spices, and meat wrapped in a banana leaf] and other dishes. Johana worked enthusiastically to build her business. She is grateful to Kiva and Micrédito as their help allowed her to expand her menu and increase demand from her customers. 

Johana is applying for a new loan to purchase corn, potatoes, tomatoes, pork, onions, rice, and other items so that she can fill orders from her customers. Johana believes that the loan will help her by boosting her income and allow her to renovate her shop and her home.

loans.use: to purchase corn, potatoes, tomatoes, pork, onions, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 44-year-old married woman who is illiterate and can only sign her name.  She lives with her husband Bhogirath and their son in the small village of Satvendi in the district Jalpaiguri. They have a small kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw).  

Kalpana's husband Bhogirath  is a farmer.  He read up to class VI (Grade 6).  To make a living he has been working in their small land to earn their family's income. But the current business does not provide them with sufficient money to meet the family's needs. Kalpana has decided to help her husband financially, so she wants to start cultivating potatoes and sell those potatoes in the market.

She requested a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing new crops in their land. She has given preference to this business of potato cultivation because it is a very profitable business in their area. She hopes that this business will prove productive for her and she will be able to help her husband financially to run the family smoothly, as well as give a better future to their son.

In the future she dreams of upgrading their kachha house to a pacca one (brick-built) with the profits she earns from her business.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells food staples such as rice, beans, sugar, and gari in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Efua is married to a fisherman and has six children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more food products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a small-scale food vendor, cooking up fried plantains, beans, and gari in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama has been working as a food vendor for close to six years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of food ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying her own food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of food ingredients thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells provisions such as gari, sugar, and soft drinks in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Ama has been working as a provisions seller for close to five years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Ama plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of owning a chain of provision shops.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any kind of formal education.  Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about ten years. As a widow with eight children, Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Abena will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of limes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of limes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She runs a chop bar (a small roadside restaurant) in Emissakrom (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of food ingredients, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of food ingredients.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Araba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Araba sells fried and smoked fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about eight years.

As a widow with two children, Araba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Araba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Araba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling limes in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Esi is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to purchase more limes. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand to meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more limes.

loans.name: Suzzy Adwowa

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Suzzy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling secondhand clothing in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Suzzy is married and has four children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Suzzy will use the loan to purchase larger quantities of secondhand clothing, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Suzzy plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Majdoleen

texts.en:
Majdoleen is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her 3 younger siblings and her parents. 

Majdoleen is pursuing her bachelor's in Class Teaching. She is in her 2nd year. She is planning to continue her study to find a good job in the teaching field after graduation. She will do this to start helping her parents financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan was born in 1990. She lives with her five siblings and her parents in a sector of Jordan, called Dairalla. She is a farmer who also been selling blankets for the last two years.  She started her project selling a small amount of blankets. Now, she wants to increase the quantity of blankets to increase her profit and income to support her family financially.  Ama doesn't have enough money to buy more blankets. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud was born in 1987. She is married and has 2 children. Kholoud has been selling blankets for 1 year. She considers her work a good source of income to support her husband and children in improving their living conditions. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala was born in 1987. She is married and has 4 children. Hala has been selling blankets for 1 year. She considers her work a good source of income to support her husband and children in improving their living conditions. 

She decided to add selling clothes to her project to raise her sales and profit. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Because Nahed is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Nahed was born in 1985. She is married and has 1 son. Nahed has been selling clothes for 2 years. She considers her work a good source of income to support her husband and son in improving their living conditions. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Victoria tiene 45 años de edad con un grado de estudio de primaria incompleta cursado hasta el quinto grado esto por la falta de dinero debido que sus padres no contaban con los recursos suficientes para que ella siguiera estudiando. Con los años ella se casó con el que hoy en día es su esposo y procrearon seis hijos de los cuales tres ya se casaron y tres están viviendo con ellos, una nuera y dos nietos, uno tiene 2 años y el otro tiene 18 meses. La primera tiene 29 años y curso hasta el sexto grado con el tiempo se casó y tiene una niña pero después se separaron y hoy en día colabora con sus padres en el campo. El segundo tiene 24 años y solo llego hasta quinto grado esto porque no le gusto el estudio y decidió trabajar con el papa hoy en día él tiene un niño de 18 meses y junto a su pareja vive en la casa de la mama. El tercero tiene 13 años y recién termino la primaria, ya que el próximo año seguirá estudiando en el colegio de la aldea y al igual que sus hermanos él se involucra también en las actividades del café. Doña Victoria tiene 2.5 manzanas en total toda es productora las cuales adquirió por esfuerzos propio ubicadas a 6 kilómetros de la casa y se trasladan en familia caminando. Al momento de trasportar el grano cosechado y recolectado lo hacen en bestia y los hijos que viven con ella se involucran en las actividades del campo ya que son una familia muy unida. Como desafió es que el precio baje en el mercado ya que ella ase todo el proceso del café, y que el intermediario no se lo compre a un precio justo.
Doña Victoria tiene como meta mejorar el estado de sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor variedad y una mayor cantidad de esa forma ella aumentara la producción y mejorara sus ingresos económicos para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en todo lo necesariamente posible para su bienestar.
Por lo que hoy día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales podrán asistir sus cultivos de café y evitara que su producto se dañe, se seque y sea afectado por alguna plaga o enfermedad como la roya y la broca.
texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old and has an incomplete elementary school education to fifth grade, due to her parents’ lack of sufficient resources for her to continue.  In time she married and she and her husband had six children, one is two years old and another is 18 months old.  The oldest is 29 and studied to sixth grade and in time married and has a daughter, she and her husband later separated and now she helps her parents in the fields.  The next oldest is 24 years old and only studied to fifth grade because he didn’t like school and decided to work with his father.  He and his wife now have an 18 month old son and at they live with their mother.  The next one is 13 years old, recently completed elementary school, and will continue his schooling the following year.  Like his siblings, he is also involved in raising coffee.

Victoria has 2.5 plots in production, which she got through her own effort and which are located 6 km from her home.  She walks there and they transport the harvested grains by pack animal.  Her children are also involved in the field activities since they are a very close family.  Her challenges are the drop in coffee prices and that the wholesaler will not pay a fair price.

Victoria has a goal of improving the state of her coffee crops by planting a better and greater variety.  In this way she can increase her production and income so that she can continue to provide for her children’s wellbeing.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies so she can help her crops and prevent damage, drying out, blights, or disease.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fried fish and etsew (a Ghanaian food staple made out of maize) in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Efua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of etsew and fried fish. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of etsew and fried fish

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a petty trader. Currently, she sells plantains in Akonoma, Cape Coast. She has been in this business for about 30 years. She is married to a carpenter and together they have seven children. Esi uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the requested loan to purchase more bags of plantains, which will aid her in improving her business. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of plantains, which will aid her in improving her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Ama is a petty trader. She specializes in selling fried fish at Akonoma in Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for close to ten years. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory, which would allow her to sell greater quantities of fried fish. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping it expand to meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fried fish.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi grew up in poverty without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she prepares and sells "kenkey," a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves, for a living. She primarily sells her kenkey at Akonoma in the Central Region. She uses the income from her business to help her husband (a carpenter) to raise their four children. 

Esi has identified growing demand among consumers for her kenkey. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, leaves, and other ingredients in order to prepare more of her tasty kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and leaves to prepare more of her tasty kenkey.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Because Aya is a conservative lady, she asked her mother to take her place in the picture. Aya was born in 1995. She is single and lives in a sector of Jordan called Marka. Aya has been selling clothes and blankets for one year. She considers her work to be a good source of income to support herself and her family in improving their living conditions. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes and blankets to raise her sales and profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana was born in 1983. She is married and has four children. Her husband is at the military. Hana has been selling accessories and cosmetic products for a year. She started her project selling a small quantity to her neighbors and friends. Now, she wants to add selling perfumes to this project in order to increase her profit and provide good financial support to her family. But Hana doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy perfumes to resell

loans.name: Manar

texts.en: Manar is 22 years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan, called Irbid, with her three older siblings and her mother. Her father has passed away. Manar is studying to get a bachelor's degree, majoring in Housing Economy. She is in her fouth year. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her field after graduation, in order to start helping her family financially.  Her family is currently facing a financial crisis after her father's death, which is not helping as she needs pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Manar applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mutaz

texts.en: Mutaz is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his three younger siblings and his parents. His father is a security man who also works at a gas station. Mutaz is studying for his bachelor's and is majoring in nursing. He is in his second year. He is planning to continue his study to find a good job in his field after graduation, and to start helping his parents financially. His parents are are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Mutaz applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thereby allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping it expand to meet customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory, thereby allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

She sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) for a living at Akonoma, Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for some years. She uses her income to provide for her entire family. Abena will use the loan to purchase increased quantities of maize, leaves, and other essentials in order to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and leaves to improve her overall sales.

She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. Mena will use the loan to purchase larger amounts of frozen chicken and meat, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her goals. Currently, she prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) at Akonoma, Cape Coast. She has been doing this work for about six years. She is married to a social welfare security officer and they have seven children. She uses all of her income to support her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase larger quantities of maize, leaves, and other ingredients to aid her in improving her overall  sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of maize and leaves to help improve her sales of kenkey

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maribel de 22 años de edad, es una persona que estudio noveno grado,  debido al poco recurso económico no pudo seguir estudiando y otro factor fue la distancia; ya que solo para llegar al Instituto más cercano está a 22 kilómetros. Hoy en día está acompañada,  su esposo trabaja como albañil y en la agricultura. Han procreado una hija de siete años de edad, que asiste a la escuela que está a una distancia de ½ kilómetro.
 
Maribel se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, el negocio lo realiza desde hace cuatro años, la ropa la compra en la capital y la vende en las comunidades de los alrededores; el trabajo lo hace tres días a la semana, eso si cuando sale lo hace todo el día y algunas veces también le paga a otra persona para que le acompañe. 
 
El préstamo solicitado a fundación campo, es para comprar madera para cambiar el techo de la casa,  ya que esta inservible y no se puede habitar.  También invertirá en más mercadería,  comprara otros productos que no tiene como lo son yinas y sandalias.

El sueño de Maribel,  es tener su propio local de venta de ropa en un mercado, donde pueda desempeñar mejor el trabajo sin mucho riesgo, y siempre pensando en que la hija pueda estudiar hasta verla una profesional.
texts.en:
Maribel is 22 years old and studied up to the 9th grade. Because of a lack of economic resources she was not able to keep studying, distance also playing a factor since the closest high school was 22 kilometres away. She is now married, her husband working as a bricklayer and farmer. They have a seven-year-old girl, who goes to school ½ kilometre away.

Maribel makes a living from the purchase and sale of clothes. She has been doing this for four years. She buys clothes in the capital and sells it in the neighbouring communities. She works three days a week, but when she does, she does it for the entire day, sometimes also paying another person to go with her.

The loan requested to Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood to change the roof of her house, since it is unworkable and uninhabitable. She will also invest in more merchandise, buying other products that she does not have, such as flip-flops and sandals.

Maribel's dream is to have her own clothing stall in a market, where she can do a better job without much risk, always thinking of her daughter, so that one day she can see her becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy wood to change the roof of her house, since it is unworkable and uninhabitable. She will also invest in more merchandise, buying other products that she does not have, such as flip-flops and sandals.

loans.name: Marady

texts.en: Marady was born in 1988. She is married and has 3 children. Marady has been selling clothes and blankets to her neighbors for three years. She considers her work to be a good source of income to support her husband and children in improving their living conditions. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of blankets to raise her sales and profit. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Na'eem

texts.en:
Na'eem is 19 years old, and he lives in Gaza. He stopped his education at grade 10, because of his hard life conditions.  He decided to open a garage, and has four years of courses in this field. Na'eem specializes in painting and repairing vehicles. This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Na'eem is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this youth loan to buy a blacksmith machine and new painting tools. Na'eem is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a blacksmith machine and new painting tools.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 18 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 6 siblings and his parents. His father is a bus driver who also works in data entry.

Mohammad is studying for a bachelor's degree majoring in computer engineering. He is in his 1st year. He is planning to continue his study to find a good job in his study field after graduation to start helping his parents financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Maycon Yakson

texts.es: Maycon, tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, y reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace dos años en busca de obtener mas ingresos, decidió tener una venta de productos básicos alimenticios como arroz, manteca, sal, café, pan, condimentos, verduras, productos enlatados y abarrotes. Este negocio lo administra junto con su esposa. El presta los servicios de capataz en una hacienda cerca donde vive y en los tiempos libres ayuda en el negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de productos como granos básicos, jabón, azúcar, pan, arroz, frijoles, café, sal, condimentos etc. y poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. El objetivo es obtener mas ingresos para arreglar su casa y para que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Maycon is 29 years old. He is married and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Two years ago, in search of a way to make more money, he decided to sell basic food products like rice, lard, salt, cafe, bread, condiments, vegetables canned goods and groceries. He runs the business with his wife. He works as an overseer on a farm close to where they live and in his spare time he helps in the store.

Maycon is requesting a loan for 15,000 HNL to stock his business with basic grains, soap, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, salt, condiments, etc. to be able to offer more variety to his clients. His goal is to make more income to fix up his house and for his children's studies.

loans.use: to stock his business with basic grains, soap, sugar, bread, rice, beans, salt, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Faustina is a businesswoman. She specializes in selling bags of limes at Akonoma, Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. She is married to a driver and together they have four children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping herself and her extended family. Faustina wants to use her loan to increase her inventory, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of limes. In the long term, Faustina plans to reinvest part of her future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand to meet rising customer demands and support her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of limes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Akonoma in the Central Region. She has been doing this work for about ten years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have one child. She uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall kenkey sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, which will aid her in improving her kenkey sales.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
В селе все знают Александра. Он очень оптимистично смотрит на свою жизнь, всегда в хорошем настроении, хороший семьянин. Его семья очень гостеприимная. Александр отличный хозяин, он никогда не сидит на месте, постоянно трудится. За 20 лет сумел развить большое хозяйство, у него  много больших высокопроизводительных теплиц. В теплицах Александр выращивает ранние овощи, такие как редис, помидоры, огурцы; при этом за год он собирает три урожая.

В этом году  осенний урожай не удался, было холодно, поэтому меньше заработали. 
Александр решил обратиться за кредитом. На полученные 40,000 гривен он приобретет котел для теплицы под рассаду, семена, пленку. Осталось не так много времени, в декабре будут уже сеять семена для нового сезона, поэтому Александр старается всё подготовить заранее.
texts.en:
Everyone in his village knows Alexander.  He has a very optimistic outlook on life, is always in a good mood, and is a good family man.  His family is very warm and welcoming.  Alexander is an excellent businessman.  He never just sits around, rather he works constantly.  Over the last 20 years, he has been able to build up a large farm and he has many highly productive greenhouses.  He raises early vegetables like radish, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and he reaps three harvests a year.

Because it was cold this year, the autumn harvest was unsuccessful and he earned less than usual.  And so, Alexander has decided to apply for a loan.  With the 40,000 hryvni (UAH) he receives, he will buy plastic greenhouse film, seed, and a boiler for the greenhouses where he raises seedlings.  There isn't much time left since planting for the next season goes on in December and Alexander tries to have everything ready in advance.

loans.use: to install heating, and purchase film and seeds for his greenhouses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Janet did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells cooking ingredients like tomatoes, onions, garden eggs (eggplant), and cooking oil at Akonoma in the Central Region. She has been involved in this enterprise for almost ten years. She is married to a driver and has five children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband pay their children’s school fees and the family's utility bills. Janet has identified growing demand among consumers for her products. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more ingredients for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children are given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty and to set up her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Urania Marbelly

texts.es: Doña urania es una señora trabajadora, su actividad comercial es la venta de ropa de segunda y nueva, y ahora bisuterías, los vende en su casa de habitación y también sale a los departamentos, en done algunas veces vale la pena hacer el viaje y otras solo saca para los gastos de transporte. Urania es  madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos están en la escuela secundaria y uno esta pequeño aun. Solicita este crédito con el fin de incrementar su inventario comprando variedades de ropa y bisutería para mejorar las ventas en esta temporada alta, para mejorar su economía y apoyar más a sus hijos en sus necesidades  básicas como lo son alimentación y educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Urania is a working woman, her job being the sale of new and secondhand clothing, and now also imitation jewellery. She sells these from her home and also to nearby [Nicaraguan] departments. Sometimes it is a worthwhile trip while other times she only recovers her transport expenses. Urania is a mother of three children, two of whom are in junior high school and the other is still very young.

She is requesting this loan in order to increase her inventory by purchasing a variety of clothing and imitation jewellery, so as to improve her economy and to continue to support her children in their basic needs, such as food and education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for women, men, children and a some imitation jewellery

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan was born in 1990. She is married and has 1 son. Her husband is in the military.

Hanan has been selling clothes and blankets for 1 year. She considers her work as a good source of income to support her husband and son in improving their living conditions. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes and blankets to raise her sales and profit, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets for her business

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is 22 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 5 siblings and his parents.

Yaseen is studying for a bachelor's degree majoring in business administration. He is in his 1st year.
