Oneida Porfiria is 35 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She completed three years of education. She raises farm animals. She started out with a few animals and now has 6 years of experience. She can count of the support of her husband who is involved in agriculture.

Oneida Porfiria organized a group and she is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase pigs, chickens and concentrated feed for them. In the future she would like to have a farm with a variety of animals and have her own capital.

The others in the group also raise domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is 51 years old and is a single mother of four grown children. She lives in her own settlement with her children. She has had her own agricultural business for almost 20 years.  She works on a small piece of land where she primarily grows rice. 

Without having a safe latrine for use at home, Tha is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. Therefore, she has requested a loan in the sum of $630 USD to build a household latrine and buy its necessary supplies. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Tha to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. This is her first loan cycle with HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its necessary supplies.

loans.name: Elvia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Elvia es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de mini pulpería, el cual lo ha logrado con mucho entusiasmo, permitiéndole generar ingresos a su hogar. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que pudo cumplir con su meta de incrementar sus productos y aumentar día a día su clientela. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pan, jabón, sal entre otros, con el fin de brindar una diversidad de productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtendrá un alto nivel de ganancias.
texts.en: Elvia is originally from the city of Granada.  She is a shopkeeper.  She has a mini-supermarket, which she has achieved with great enthusiasm. This has allowed her to generate income for her home.  She is thankful to Kiva and MiCrédito as she has been able to achieve her goal of increasing her product selection and adding customers day by day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bread, soap, and salt, among other items, with the goal of having a diverse selection of products.  She believes the loan will be of great help to her by increasing her sales, resulting in higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, bread, soap, and salt, among other items.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is 53 years old and married with eleven children. With two children currently in school, Rufina works very hard to provide for them. Rufina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft-drinks, cream, milk, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell. Rufina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, cream, milk, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc. In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft-drinks, cream, milk, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Melinda requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Melinda has been in this business for 2 years.

Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Doña Enma es una mujer muy trabajadora de 54 años de edad, casada, su grado de educación es primaria incompleta cursando 3 años únicamente ya que por la poca economía en su familia no pudo continuar estudiando, madre de 2 hijos quienes viven en hogares a parte y le ayudan en sus cultivos de café en ocasiones involucrándose en la corta y recolección del grano. Doña Enma tiene mucha experiencia en la caficultura ya que aprendió desde temprana edad en compañía de sus padres y sigue ejerciendo en compañía de su esposo por más de 28 años. Ella también realiza otras actividades para generar ingresos para su familia como la venta de leche de vaca y sus derivados. El terreno donde ellos cultivan fue donado por sus padres ubicado a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación por lo que en ocasiones se trasladan caminando y a veces en vestía para luego comenzar su labor de abonar y limpiar sus cultivos. En esta actividad solo ellos 2 se involucran y pagan mano de obra ya que no cuentan con suficiente fuerza para hacerlo ellos dos únicamente. Doña Enma espera obtener una excelente cosecha ya que de esto depende la economía de su hogar vendiendo su producción a los intermediarios que llegan a la localidad y a las diferentes bodegas de la zona.
Por lo que necesita financiamiento para la compra de abono, foliares, mano de obra y para poder asistir sus cultivos de café generando más ingresos y poder cumplir con sus metas de seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café, mejorar sus casa de habitación ya que necesita mantenimiento y seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos, nietos y demás generaciones.
texts.en:
Enma is a hardworking woman who is 54 years old. She is married, and she has only completed three years of primary education. It was because of her family's poor economic status that she could not continue studying.

Enma is the mother of two children who live in separate homes, and who help her occasionally with her coffee crops, cutting and harvesting the beans. Enma has a lot of experience in the cultivation of coffee because she learned at a very early age from her parents, and she has been performing this trade with her husband for more than 28 years. 

She also does other things to generate income for her family such as selling cow's milk as well as dairy products.  The land that she cultivates was given to her by her parents, and it is located three kilometers from her home, which she can reach walking, sometimes dressed for her work fertilizing and cleaning the crops.

She and her husband are the only ones involved in this business, and they pay for labor because they don't have enough strength to do it by themselves. Enma hopes to have an excellent harvest because this is what the economy of her home depends on -- selling the output to the intermediaries who come to her town and the different stores in the area. 

This is why she needs financing to purchase fertilizers, liquid plant food, and labor that will be able to support her coffee cultivation and generate more income. Enma will also be able to reach her goals of continuing to expand her coffee crops, improve her home because it needs maintenance, and to keep strengthening her heritage for her children, grandchildren, and further generations.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies to support her coffee crops

loans.name: Ibis Olanda

texts.es:
Ibis es una joven de 26 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, casada, madre de 3 hijos los cuales están pequeños y estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria incompleto cursado hasta el cuarto grado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarle para que ella pudiese seguir estudiando. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una tradición que viene de generación en generación y junto a su esposo trabajan desde hace 5 años. En compañía de su esposo diariamente se dirigen hasta sus cultivos de café caminando por 40 minutos los cuales son propios gracias a una herencia familiar.
Ella actualmente ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL financiamiento con el cual pretende comprar fertilizantes y abonos que ayudaran mediante la aplicación a mantener limpio sus cultivos de café siendo esta su única actividad económica para su familia.
Sus metas son los de poder cultivar una mejor y mayor variedad de café, que sea competitiva en el mercado por su calidad y por su sabor como el borbone entre otros que son de gran éxito en el mundo. Sus sueños poder mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y seguir adelante con cada uno de los proyectos que tiene para triunfar en la vida teniendo como prioridad la educación de sus hijos y el fortalecimiento del patrimonio.
texts.en:
Ibis is a young woman who is 26 years old.  She is a housewife and works in agriculture.  She is married and has 3 small children who are in different levels of primary school.  She did not complete the final yea of primary school. She attended school until the fourth grade, but because her parents had scarce financial resources they could not support her so that she could continue attending school.  Her parents taught her to work the land at a very young age.  In her family it is a tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation.  She has worked along with her husband for the past 5 years. Along with her husband, she walks 40 minutes to their coffee fields every day.  They own the fields thanks to a family inheritance.

She is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to be used to purchase fertilizers that will be applied in order to keep the coffee plants clean.  The coffee fields are her family's only economic activity.  Her goal is to grow a better and larger variety of coffee that will be competitive in the market for is quality and flavor, such as bourbon, among others that have been very successful in the world. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions and to make progress with each of the projects she has in order to triumph in life.  Her priority is the education of her children and improving the family's assets.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Sergelen is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been decorating interior parts of houses for a living since 2010. His wife works at a network marketing company as a consultant. Their children are growing day to day and he has to provide for the needs of his children such as education, food and interests. 

He decided to provide taxi service to local people during his day off. For this effort, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy a natural gas vehicle. The advantage of this particular car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it wastes less fuel and emits fewer pollutants. In short, taxi service using natural gas car should be encouraged everywhere as it is a green business.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas car

loans.name: Galaa

texts.en:
Galaa is 43 years old and lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. Galaa has been working as a welder at a steel factory since 2003. His wife is self-employed and makes and sells needlework to local people. 

Galaa is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to buy a car which runs on natural gas. The car will be used by him for taxi services as he wants to generate additional income for his family. Also, the advantage of a natural gas car is great as it emits less pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy a car which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco, casado padre de un niños en edad escolar se dedica a la venta de Frutas y veduras al por mayor su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar, su mayor sueño y meta es terminar su humilde vivienda, el credito lo solicita para compra de materiales como: zinc, arena, cemento,ceramica para darle asi una mojara a su casita, el espera contar siempre con el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Francisco is married and the father of a school-aged child.  He sells fruit and vegetables wholesale. His wife takes care of the house. His main dream and goal is to complete the construction of his modest house. The loan Francisco is requesting is to buy materials like zinc sheeting, sand, cement and tiles to give his house a facelift. He hopes he can count on the help that Kiva and Afodenic have always given him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Brenda Damaris

texts.es: La señora Brenda habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, casada madre de un niño en edad escolar, su actividad comercial es la venta de Ropa, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ella ademas trabaja para una empresa privada, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Ropa como pantalones, blusas, faldas etc. ademas espera que sus ganancias sean buenas para asi contribuir con la construccion de su vivienda ya que esta en planes de mejorarla, agradece el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Brenda lives in the town of Ticuantepe. She is married and is the mother of one school-aged son. She sells clothing and her husband is a farmer. She also works for a private business.

She asks for a loan to buy clothing like pants, blouses, skirts, etc. She hopes that she will have good earnings so that she can contribute to the construction of her home, since they are planning to improve it. She is grateful for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Doña Juana mujer trabajadora y entregasa a sus hijos, su esposo la apoya economicamente, la actividad comercial de doña juana es la venta de Zapatos, por lo que el credito lo solicita para la compra de calzado para niños, adolecentes y adultos ella espera que esn esta tempora sus ventas incremente un poco ya que con sus ganancia pretende invertir en ponor bonito su negocio, agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Juana is a hardworking woman who gives a lot to her children. Her husband supports her financially. Juana sells shoes, and has asked fro a loan to buy shoes for children, adolescents and adults. She hopes that during this season her sales will increase a bit, because she plans to invest in improving the look of her business. She is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Bambina

texts.en:
Bambina is 41 years old and dreams of being more successful in her business.  She hopes to help her family financially. This causes her to work hard in her piggery business. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase five sacks of feed, medicine and vitamins. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to nourish her pigs and sell them to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of feed, medicine and vitamins.

loans.name: Ramona De Jesus

texts.es:
María es una señora de 43 años, vive en unión libre con Jesús, vive junto a él,  ya hace varios años, hoy conforman una hermosa familia con 2 hijos, el mayor que ya tiene familia, y el menor que tiene 12 años y cursa sus estudios secundarios, su esposo se dedica a realizar fletes transporta personas, mercaderías, entre otros; labora para el dueño del vehículo ya que su condición económica no le ha permitido adquirir su propio medio de trabajo.
María y su familia viven en Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas una nueva provincia de Ecuador, que por su excelente ubicación geográfica es conocida como el puente de unión entre la Sierra y la Costa; además que cuenta con un  clima cálido húmedo lo que permite que tenga gran producción agrícola.
María se dedica a la venta de cosméticos ocasionalmente, pero desde hace un tiempo su fuerte es preparar asados para la venta, actividad que la realiza en su hogar en un pequeño horno que adquirió con sus ahorros para emprender su pequeño negocio, ella y su familia viven hace 5 años en el Barrio la Castellana, este sector es muy transitado por esto su negocio ha crecido en este corto tiempo, el crédito al que aplica María lo invertirá en la reparación del tejado de su vivienda y en la compra de sillas y mesas para adecuar su negocio, y ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes, , hoy en día María agradece a Fundación alternativa y a Kiva por facilitar que su gran sueño de superación se haga realidad.
texts.en:
Ramona de Jesus is 43 years old, and she lives with Jesús. They have been together for several years, and today form a beautiful family with two children. The older already has a family, and the younger is 12 years old and is attending secondary school. Her husband works transporting people and goods, among other things. He works for the owner of a vehicle because his economic situation has not allowed him to acquire his own means of work.

Ramona and her family live in San Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a new province of Ecuador that, being the bridge between the mountains and the coast, is known as an excellent geographic location. It also has a warm, humid climate which allows for great agricultural production.

Ramona works selling cosmetics occasionally, but for a time, her strength is preparing grilled meats to sell, an activity she does in her home using a small oven that she purchased for starting her small business. She and her family have lived in the Barrio la Castellana for five years. This sector is well-traveled, which is why her business has grown in this short time.

Ramona is applying for credit to invest in the repair of the roof of her home and in the purchase of chairs and table to furnish her business and offer better service to her customers. Today she is grateful to Fundación Alternative and to Kiva for making her great dream of improving herself become a reality.

loans.use: repair the roof of her home and purchase chairs and tables to furnish her business.

loans.name: Arelys Mercedes

texts.es: Arelys es originaria de la ciudad de Puerto Cabezas, casada y sin hijos a cargos. De 28 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatos. El cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante. Este negocio lo inicio hace varios años; su esposo heredo ese taller que pertenecía a su padre. Desde entonces, su esposo le enseño lo básico, a partir de ahí, entre los dos han logrado un taller con una producción de zapatos prospera y de calidad. Su meta es extender su negocio y mantener los materiales para la elaboración de zapatos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: clavitos o tachuelas, cuero, suelas, pegas, cordones entre otros, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que aumentara los pedidos y tendrá un mejor volumen de ventas, y sobre todo, obtendrá buenas ganancias. su plan futuro es adquirir maquinaria para la producción de sus zapatos e ir así incrementando su capital.
texts.en:
Arelys is originally from the city of Puerto Cabezas, married and has no children under her care.  Since the age of 28 she has been as a shopkeeper, working to make and sell shoes, which with a lot of will-power she has managed to get ahead in.

She started this business many years ago; her husband inherited the workshop which belong to his father.  Since then, her husband taught her the basics, and from then on between the two of them they have succeeded in a workshop with a prosperous and high quality production of shoes. 

Her goal is to expand their business and maintain the materials used in shoe production.  She is requesting the loan to buy small nails or tacks, leather, soles, glue, shoelaces, etc with the goal of offering a better service and meeting their clients' demands.  She believes than the loan will helpful to her since it will increase the orders and she will have a better volume of sales and, above all, will make good profits.  

Their future plan is to acquire machinery to produce shoes and increase their capital that way.

loans.use:
to buy nails or tacks, leather, soles, glue, shoelaces, etc.

para comprar: clavitos o tachuelas, cuero, suelas, pegas, cordones entre otros.

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie is 59-years-old and married with three children.

Armie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Armie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty-three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock and farming sugarcane.

Armie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shinekhuu

texts.en:
Shinekhuu is 50 years old andlives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook assistant in a restaurant since her retirement in 2010. Her husband works at an urban development agency as a car driver. Her elder daughter runs a modeling agency. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to buy an automobile which runs on natural gas. The car will be used by her family for transportation. As they get older it is hard to walk or go by public transport. Another advantage of this particular car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities as it emits less pollutants and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es: Diana es una mujer emprendedora que, a sus 33 años de edad desea iniciar su propio negocio, la idea surge de la necesidad de generar ingresos para su sustento y de la dificultad para conseguir oportunidades de empleo. El establecimiento estará ubicado en su lugar de residencia, en un espacio que adecuó para tal fin, allí ofrecerá productos de la canasta familiar, mecato, cervezas, gaseosas, entre otros pero para lograr su objetivo solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar dos mesas, sillas, un enfriador, una vitrina, estanterías, surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, cárnicos, gaseosas, cervezas, galletería, dulces, pastas, panela, entre otros), realizar adecuaciones locativas (pintura e instalación de estantes) y pagar la mano de obra de la pintura y la instalación de estanterías; de esta manera podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo y comenzará a percibir los ingresos necesarios para su sustento y para apoyar económicamente a su familia. Diana sabe que para lograr sacar adelante su proyecto debe trabajar con empeño, dedicación y disciplina, de esta forma podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es mejorar la calidad de vida con la rentabilidad que le brinde su actividad y cada día fortalecerlo más para que sea perdurable en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Diana is an enterprising woman who, at 33, wishes to start her own business.  The idea is coming from the need to generate income for her livelihood and from the difficulty of finding work.  The establishment will be located in her place of residence, in a space adequate for her goal, it will offer basic goods: rope, beer, soda, among other things but to meet her goal she is asking for the support of the loan.  With it she wants to buy two tables, chairs, a cooler, a display case, shelves, wholesale supplies (rope, dairy products, meat products, soda, beer, cookies, candy, pasta, brown sugar, etc), make changes in the store (painting and installing shelves) and paying for the labor to paint and install the shelves.

This is how she will be able to start her productive project and will start to earn the needed income to support herself and economically support her family.  Diana knows that be able to get ahead her in project she will have to work with tenacity, dedication and discipline.  This is how she will advance toward accomplishing her main dream which is to improve her quality of life with the profitability that her business brings, each day making it stronger so that it is long-lasting.

loans.use: to buy two tables, chairs, a cooler, a display cabinet, shelves, wholesale supplies (rope, dairy products, meat products, soda, beer, cookies, candy, pasta, brown sugar, etc), make changes in the store (painting and installing shelves) and paying for the labor to paint and install the shelves.

loans.name: Xepequen Us Group

texts.es:
La señora Estefan de estado civil casada. Tiene 35 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando. Se dedica a la agricultura, espefíficamente a la siembra de Ejote Frnancés, maíz y frijol. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar fertilizante para el mantenimiento de sus cosechas. En el futuro desea tenere contar con mas terreno para poder sembrar mas y exportar sus productos. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de ejote frnancés, maíz y frijol.
texts.en: Estefan, 35, is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She did not have the chance to go to school herself. She works as a farmer, specifically planting french green beans, corn and beans. She started this business with a little bit of capital that her husband gave her and now has been at it for 5 years. She organized a group and asked for a loan in order to buy fertilizer to maintain her crops. In the future she hopes to have more land so that she can plant more crops and export her products. The other members of the group plant green beans, corn and beans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sakhon

texts.en:
Sakhon is 41 years old and married. She is the mother of one child who is still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 5 years. The current business earns her about $9 USD per day to support her family’s needs.

Sakhon has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and she completely paid back the past loan which helped her better support her family. Now she is asking for another loan to pay for the tuition fees for her daughter to study information technology. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school until graduation.  

Noted : This picture includes her daughter.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
Doña Jerónima es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante de 41 años de edad la cual es casada y madre de 2 hijos pequeños que están al cuidado de ella y su esposo ya que estudian en la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad. Doña Jerónima aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura ya que desde muy pequeña apoyaba a su padre en la tierra que el cultivaba y hoy en día sigue apoyando de diferente manera hoy con su esposos con el cual lo hace desde hace 10 años. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo trabaja es propio gracias a una herencia de sus padres ubicados en la misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando por más de 20 minutos desde su casa de habitación. Doña Jerónima en su juventud no pudo estudiar por lo que su grado de educación es de primaria cursando 3 años ya que ya que la economía en su hogar no era la mejor en su juventud pero aprendió a trabajar fuertemente para educar sus hijos.
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad con carreras que ayuden al crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su conocimiento en esta vida para poder integrarse a la sociedad de manera que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, con un mejor futuro y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. Como meta para sus cultivos ampliarlos de manera que pueda sembrar una nueva plantilla de café para seguir generando ingresos y hacer realidad sus sueños como también fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual asistirá sus cultivos aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades
texts.en:
Jerónima is an enterprising 41 year old woman with much desire to get ahead. She is married and the mother of two small children who are in the care of her and her husband. They are studying at the local primary school.

Jerónima learned about farming at a young age, helping her father on the land he farmed. Today she has been supporting her husband in a different manner for the past 10 years. The land they work is hers, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. It is in the same community they live in, about a 20 minute walk from their home.

Jerónima could not study in her youth. She completed grade 3 as the economic situation in her home was not good. But she learned how to work very hard to educate her children. She dreams of seeing them graduate from university in courses that help them grow and strengthen their knowledge about life. Then they can integrate well into society and enjoy better opportunities in life and a better future.

As a goal for her crops she hopes to expand so she can start new plantings of coffee to continue to generate revenues and realize her dreams and to strengthen her assets for her children. For this reason Jerónima is requesting a loan to assist her crops applying agricultural supplies like fertilizer, manure, nutritional formula, and fungicides to avoid infestations from insects and blights.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to protect and assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es una joven de 27 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora madre de un solo hijo el cual tiene una edad de 2 años en un estado civil en unión libre. Tiene un grado de estudio de primaria incompleto cursando únicamente el primer año de educación ya que no contó con el apoyo financiero de sus padres siendo estos de escasos recursos económicos. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de hogar con el que asiste sus cultivos de café desarrollando actividades como limpieza, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, foliares, etc. manteniendo sanos y protegidos sus cultivos de café. El terreno es una que juntos trabajan es una herencia de sus padres a quienes agradece por tal regalo para poder trabajar y generar ingresos para su familia y hogar ubicado a media hora de sus casa de habitación. Sus clientes son las bodegas de café en las zonas aledañas, vecinos e intermediarios que buscan de un buen producto para revender. 
Ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como urea, abono, entre otros con los que podrá asistir su cosecha de café la cual al final de la temporada espera obtener muy buenas resultados, ganancias y seguir re invirtiendo en las mismas.      
Sus planes para el futuro son los de seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra y de esa forma sembrar una mejor y mayor cantidad de café. Como madre sus sueños son los de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su vivienda, entre otras necesidades que son necesarias atenderlas pero principal mente la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a young woman, 27 years old, housewife, farmer and mother just one child who is 2 and is in a common-law marriage. She has an incomplete primary education, studying only the first year of education since she didn't have the financial support of her parents since they lacked financial resources.

She counts on the support of her partner, which helps her grow coffee and come up with activities such as cleaning, applying manure, fertilizers, plant fertilizers, etc, keeping her coffee crops healthy and safe. The ground they work together on is an inheritance from her parents to whom she is thankful for such a gift where she can work and create income for her family and home.  It is located half an hour from their home.

Their clients are the small coffee stores in the surrounding zones, neighbors and middlemen who look for a good product to resell. 

These days she is requesting funding to buy farming supplies such as urea, manure, etc with which she will be able to help her coffee crop, which at the end of the of season she hopes to have very good results, profits, and continue re-investing in themselves.

Her plans for the future are to continue increasing her coffee crops by buying more land and therefore planting a better and larger quantity of coffee.  As a mother her dreams are those of improving the conditions of life in her family, her home, among other necessities which must be attended to, but chiefly, the education of her son.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, among other things to help her grow coffee.

loans.name: Mavis Coritza

texts.es: Mavis, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija,  y reside en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Hace tres años dejo de trabajar en una fabrica maquiladora y para tener sus ingresos decidió establecer una pulpería y vender productos alimenticios como jugos, refrescos, productos enlatados, carnes, lácteos, maíz, frijoles, jabón, manteca, arroz, azúcar, sal, pan y otros.  Lleva dos ciclos de préstamo con el actual que es por 25,000 Lempiras, con el cual va invertir en la compra de productos lácteos como queso, crema, leche, refrescos, churros, pollo, productos enlatados y otros para vender con el fin de aumentar el inventario y las ventas. Su meta es crecer como comerciante y recibir buenos ingresos para darle mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en: Mavis is 32 years old, a single mother, has one daughter, and lives in San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Three years ago she left working in a factory and in order to have income she decided to establish a small convenience store and sell food products such as juices, soda pop, canned goods, meat, dairy products, corn, beans, soap, butter, rice, sugar, salt, bread and other items. She has participated in two loan cycles and with this request for 25,000 Lempiras she will invest in buying dairy products such as cheese, cream, milk, soda pop, churros, chicken, canned goods and other items to sell with the goal of increasing her inventory and sales. Her goal is to grow as a businesswoman and have good income to provide a better quality of life to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, milk, soda pop, churros, chicken, canned goods and other items to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting her family. She belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start doing embroidery work at home. She has been learning these arts for many years, and now she has adopted it for her occupation. In this way, she had enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial to her and her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery work.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, age 37, is from a rural area in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. She lives with her husband and children. Sophat has been engaged in the agricultural business to earn a livelihood. Having been in the farming business for more than 15 years, she can earn approximately USD 7 per day. Her husband and children assist her greatly in her everyday farming chores.

Since she doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this particular reason, she has requested a loan of USD 2,500 to build a household latrine and buy its necessities. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy supplies for it

loans.name: Lufi

texts.en: Lufi is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Lufi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Lufi hopes to improve her business to gain more money to support her family and her children as well

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes

loans.name: Paupusi

texts.en: Paupusi is a 47-year-old woman who is married with six children .She runs a business tailoring clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Paupusi has requested a loan to buy needles, threads, material (fabric) and a sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to extend her business, support her family and support her child's education.. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, needles, scissors and a sewing machine

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 30-year-old single woman with two children. She makes and sells snacks, ice cakes, and coconut buns in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience in this business. Salome needs a loan to buy noodles, snacks, foam cups, sack of sugar, and cordial. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Salome has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to pay for noodles, snacks, foam cups, sack of sugar, cordial, bag of flour, etc.

loans.name: Elvia Leticia

texts.es: Elvia, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.  Con el fin de obtener ingresos para su hogar, hace 8 meses que decidió establecer su propio negocio de una mini pulpería donde vende productos básicos alimenticios  como ser arroz, manteca, azúcar, galletas, dulces, churros, pastas, jabón y otros.  Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería de productos como azúcar, arroz, manteca, churros, galletas, dulces, detergentes etc. Y poder aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es continuar creciendo con el negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Elvia, who is 34 years old, is married with two children. She and her family live in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. With the goal of obtaining income for her home, she decided 8 months ago to establish her own business, a mini-store where she sells basic nutrients and products such as rice, butter, sugar, cookies, candies, churros, pasta, detergent and soap, among other things.
She decided to request a loan of 8,000 Lempiras to stock her business with products such as those described above. And she hopes to be able to increase her sales and earnings. Her goal is to continue growing her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to stock her store with products such as sugar, rice, butter, churros, cookies, candies, and detergents.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en: Jeny, 40 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She's been into the hog-raising business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 per hog. Her profits are spent on their electric bills and foods. Due to financial constraints, she would like to take a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase hog feed. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve and expand her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en: Anselma owns a general store selling home products and school and office supplies in her community for a living. She always finds ways to augment her store, since it helps her a lot as their source of income. After running her business for many years, she earns well for the family needs and has been able to repay her previous loans successfully. Recently, she requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional school and office supplies. In the future, she plans to expand her business to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional school and office supplies

loans.name: Siole

texts.en:
Siole is a 26-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation, and she grows taro, taamu (A large root vegetable like taro), bananas, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Siole has requested a loan to use for purchasing fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayers, axes, rakes, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since this year. With her profits, Siole hopes to improve her plantation and support her family and children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 58-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows rice and yams to sell for a profit. At the same time, Ly runs a small grocery store where she sells different grocery products and household goods in daily demand. She is happy because her spouse and children assist her greatly in her everyday activities.

To continue running her grocery store in a sustainable way, Ly needs a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy more products to sell in her store such as grocery products, snacks, sweets and other miscellaneous household items. With her profits, Ly hopes to pay for their daily meals and the children's education and save for the future needs of the family. She and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their financial support, which allows her to maintain and develop her current business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, snacks, sweets and more to sell

loans.name: Faasiu

texts.en: Faasiu is a 54-year-old woman who is married with nine children. She runs a business tailoring clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Faasiu has requested a loan to buy needles, threads, material (fabric) and a sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to extend her business, and support her family and her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Janireh

texts.en:
Janireh has been running a motorcycle transportation service-based business for two years, earning well for his family. He was able to repay his previous loan from GDMPC, which he used for motor repairs. 

He carries passengers in the community on weekends and in his vacant time from his work as a security guard. He always finds ways to augment his living. He wants to give a better living to his only son in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance costs and accessories, such as a helmet and raincoat.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
María Elvira de 40 años de edad es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos sueños para ella y su familia, madre de una hija la cual es mayor y vive bajo su techo colaborando con las diferentes actividades en el hogar y en el campo. María Elvira tiene un grado de estudio de primaria cursado hasta el quinto grado pues no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Junto a su esposo y su hija se dirigen hacia sus cultivos diariamente en donde son asistidos mediante la limpieza, aplicación de abono, foliares entre otros que ayudan a mantenerlos sanos de plagas, bichos y heladas (factor clima). María Elvira tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde muy temprana edad aprendió a trabajar gracias a sus padres y en compañía de su esposo lo practica desde hace 20 años. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada muy cerca de sus casa de habitación (10 minutos) a la cual se traslada caminando. 
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros que ayudaran a sus cultivos a estar más sanos y protegidos de plagas, bichos entre otros.
Sus metas es ser una de las mejores productoras de café entre otros de la zona atrayendo más clientes para su negocio y creciendo en variedad y calidad como también seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra para sembrar una nueva plantilla de café.
texts.en:
María Elvira is 40, a woman with much strength and many dreams for her and her family, mother to a daughter that is grown up and lives with her contributing to the different home activities and out in the filed.  Maria Elvira has an elementary level of school up to 5th grade, she wasn't able to continue due to lack of financial resources from her parents.  With her husband and daughter they go to the plantation daily where they work on cleaning, applying fertilizers and other activities to maintain them free of weeds, insects and freezing.  Maria Elvira has a  lot of experience because at an early age she learned to work thanks to her parents and now with her husband she has 20 years of experience.  The land that they work is their own thanks to an inheritance from her parents, it's located very close to her residence (about 10 minutes) and she gets there walking.  She is requesting financing to the cooperative COMIXMUL, with which she will be able to buy different types of fertilizers that will help her plantation to be in good shape and protected from weeds, insects and other.
Her goals are to be one of the best coffee producers of the area, attracting customers to her business, growing in variety and quality and, continue expanding the coffee plantation through the purchase of more land to start a new plantation.

loans.use: to buy different types of fertilizer to maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks, such as eggs, snack foods, soft-drinks, sugar, dried fish, coffee, milk, etc. to resell.

Gina has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items, such as eggs, snack foods, soft-drinks, sugar, dried fish, coffee, milk, etc. 

Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, such as eggs, snack foods, soft-drinks, sugar, dried fish, coffee, milk, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Herminia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Herminia has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs
